Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Adventure: Luxury”
Reviews.Author: canswiss
Reviews.Content: This review is part one of twoâ€¦ We stayed at the â€œArmada Annexâ€�, a pair of small apartments owned and run by the hotel, but which are listed on TA as the â€œStablesgate House & Studiosâ€�. This review is for the hotel services and breakfast, the second review is on the Stablesgate page and is about the rooms and property. The location is walking distance from the old town and Blue Mosque, and only a couple blocks from the Topkapi gate,â€¦but with that said, the Armada is slightly further away from the touristy sites than most other hotels. The Armada is a larger older hotel just behind the old city wall on the seacoast. The building itself doesnâ€™t look like much from the outside, but it is nicely decorated inside, and very well kept. The lobby is full of history and memorabilia to show the pedigree of the place. The lobby, bar, and house are all slightly nostalgic to an earlier Istanbul â€“ which fits with the old cars and the old bus that the hotel has (available for hire) for touring customers around. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace which is a glasshouse popping out of the roof of the hotel, looking in one direction onto the Marmara sea and over to Asia; and in the other direction up to the Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the surrounding historic quartier. There is also a open terrace for when the weather is warmer and sunny. Between the views, the birds and the rooftop action there is always something to look at. However this is only a minor distraction from the breakfast buffet! The food is excellent, opulent, plentiful, and is a mix of Turkish and western breakfast foods: Cheese, olives, dried fruit, and boerek - or if you prefer, muesli, toast, jams, and omelette. The self-pressed fresh orange juice was fantastic! The staff, â€¦both the wait-service staff and the hotel desk staff were also extremely helpful, professional, and friendly. They offered us umbrellas when they knew the weather would turn in the afternoon, and gave good advice for finding obscure shops and galleries. All in all we were very pleased with the Armada, and can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Anne P
Reviews.Content: The room and terrace restaurant have a fabulous view of the blue mosque and hagia Sophia. You can walk anywhere from this location. The staff was so helpful. It feels liike a family run place. Breakfast was yummy!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect journey!”
Reviews.Author: Elisa R
Reviews.Content: All was perfect!!!! And the breakfast at the terrace with the Bosforo!!! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Armada Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Geoff R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Armada Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed a very pleasant stay. We thought the hotel was clean, comfortable, and well appointed. The restaurant was excellent, the service from the staff was superb and the prices very reasonable. The house wines were the best value for money in Istanbul. The service from the reception staff was very good the Hospitality Manager attended to all requests for information and bookings promptly and courteously. We stayed in two standard double rooms which were large enough (there are larger rooms which looked very spacious) with good modern showers, mini bar and tea/coffee making facilities. Altogether an excellent place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place with old world charm but with all modern comforts.”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The location, just below the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, could not be better. The staff were warm, welcoming and helpful. The hotel has tons of charm -- the bedrooms have wonderfully painted panels, the entrance to the restaurant has a couple of old birdcages with colorful finches, the lobby is full of old memorabilia, and is at the same time comfortable, efficient and well functioning. The breakfast was one of the best I've had in any hotel anywhere, and the dinner was delicious. The view from the restaurant of the Sea of Marmara on one side and the aforementioned mosques on the other was fantastic. For someone who avoids modern hotel chains, it had all the qualities I look for in a hotel. A very happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Armada Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ookami59
Reviews.Content: Great place, all major attractions in walking distance. Nice and clean rooms, very friendly staff. Breakfast was also very good, its served on the rood terasse (covered in winter) with a great view to the blue mosque otr towards the ocean. I also liked the interior not onlz in the lobby but everywhere. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: petroscf
Reviews.Content: What to say about this hotel? Spaces, ambience, cleanliness, staff friendliness and service, comfort, food, everything is just perfect and in a way far better and more personal comparing to the usual indiferent standard 4 or 5 star hotels... The place is unique, 5 minutes walk from the most important monuments of the city (St. Sofia church, the blue mosque and topkapi palace) and at the same time, not far (with a taxi) from many other important places. However, although so near a highly touristic part, the road is very-very quiet!! The view from the 2nd rooms on both sides of the building is very nice, (front: Marmara sea, rear: a turkish neighbourhood a bit poor, but of quite local colour, and the tops of St Sophia church and Blue Mosque to the back!!)just ask not to be given 1st floor rear looking rooms(these ones have a small problem, looking at a backyard). Breakfast buffet....Simply, one of the best I have ever seen in my life... Ambience as a whole: If it is your 1st time in Istanbul, I blieve in Armada you are getting a good first impression of this city!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: Roberta C
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel, close to all the important sites to visit. Our room was lovely, nice and tidy and with a view on the sea and the walls. Very good service - everybody was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was delicious and abundant with a very wide choice. Worth a stay there, and I'd definitely choose this hotel again and recommend it to friends. Roberta Clerici

Reviews.Title: “Armada Hotel's Great Location & Fine Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Robert20110111
Reviews.Content: Armada Hotel is located inside the old city of Istanbul (Constantinople / Byzantium) near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, & Tokapi Palace. Within walking distance of this clean, attractive, comfortable Hotel you have many tiny cafes, restaurants, shops, and historic sites. The breakfast included with the room is generous and the staff are very, very helpful for first-time visitors. You can walk up the hill to see the sites & the Bosphorous is close by for pictures. We found our room to be extremely comfortable and ecologic.

Reviews.Title: “Armada Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salomine T
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Dec 2011 in the Armada. It is very well located for sightseeing, with all the main attractions within walking distance. The rooms are comfortable and clean and eveybody is very friendly. The roof terrace has a beautiful view of the Hagia Sopia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time here”
Reviews.Author: nas000
Reviews.Content: The location is ok, you do have to climb up to the top of Sultanahmet to see the sites and then come back down again. We tried to us a taxi but they try and rip you off do the best mode of transport was from the nearby railway station. Breakfast was very good but never leave your plate unattended otherwise the staff think you have finished and take it away. There is a beautiful view across the Maramara sea from the restaurant. A good restaurant for dinner is hard to find if you decide to wander out, but you can go On the train to Kumkapi where there quite a few. Also quite interesting watching the turtles in the fountain at reception. The staff were always friendly helpful and courteous. Definitely worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 1212rocky1212
Reviews.Content: great location within walking distance of mosques, Topaki Palace, and train, excellent views of sea on one side and Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque on the other, nice dining experience at a roof top restaurant, clean rooms and competent staff

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located; nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BLA07
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here back in April (meant to write sooner than this) and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. It's a bit of a ways from the airport, but ideally located for visits to the many historical attractions in Istanbul. The rooftop restaurant is pretty good but, if you're so inclined, many, many other places it eat nearby. My five voting points: 1. Bed: very comfortable 2. Towels: good size, fluffy and smell fresh (thanks, FM) 3. Free internet: yes. 4. Scrambled eggs: the free breakfast here is unbelievable. Never got to the eggs!! 5. Shower pressure: not great, but OK With only one out of my five points missed, I gotta give 'em an excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a city trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NicvicBelgium46
Reviews.Content: When our friend annonced us her wedding in Istanbul, we decided to go on citytrip and join her wedding day to. So we choose Armada after talking to her and we don't complain, it was cold in Istanbul, but room was comfortable warm and quiet. breakfast had a various choise, reception was helpfull 24/24 We had 2 dinners in the armada restaurant and they were very tasty and normal price. But with the wine it went totally wrong. Cork taste, second weather didn't understand us and at the end when the bill came to sign I finally got a responsable young lady at the table. I explained her. She offered new bottle,But we refused, she kindly offered Tea, what we accepted We got tea with a variaty of desserts as compsention. The hotel terrace has a magnificent view on the blue Mosq and aya sofia. Hotel is nearby all historycal sites but on sea leval. Narrow streets to climb up. Elder people can easy go up by Taxi (8 lira=3â‚¬). I wish to thank Armada staff for the splendid week we had at there plac.

Reviews.Title: “Bullet proof Honnesty.”
Reviews.Author: RosarioT_11
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel is walking distance from the main historical places of Istambul. It is quiet, clean and beautiful. The restaurant at night has an amazing view of the Hagia Sophia and many Mosques apart from a delicious food. Neverthless what surprised me most was the excellency of the staff. After I left the country I realized I had forgotten some money (brazilian currency) in my safe. I phoned without much hope of ever seeing that money again. Not only they found the money but they didn't relax until that money was in my account. I want to give special thanks to Mr. Osman Baslamisli for his efforts to resolve my problem. So, when I return to Istambul, I know exactly where I will stay...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with the best breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and Armada. First of all the breakfast is great and the view fron the dinning room is fantastic. The people who work in Armada is very helpful. The location of the htl is great and I can recommed this!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitelly come back”
Reviews.Author: NathalieR6
Reviews.Content: Second year in a row I come to Istanbul for a times event and second year in a row I stay in this beautiful hotel! Everything was perfect starting off with the reception and the courtesy we were received with and ending up with every other small detail! The cleanliness, the safety, the food, the breakfast is excellent and is served at the terrace where you can really enjoy a wonderful view over the Bosphorus from one side and from the other side Aya Sofia and the blue mosque. Although very central in the old city, Armada hotel has the benefit of being located in a quiet street and thus no worries about being awaken by any street sound. It is located also in the heart of the amazing Sultanahmet area where every touristic site is at reach... Topcapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the Grand Bazar are some of the main attractions of the city! The tramway is at a 5 minutes walk from the hotel and will take you everywhere you wish very easily, unless you prefer to take a taxi. I personally prefer the Tramway, even though it may be a bit crowded at times but it allows you to get closer to the Istanbuli life. Armada Hotel, I am definitely coming back next year! See you then!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mylomonkey
Reviews.Content: The Armada was a pleasant surprise. It was clean and quiel. The room was delightfully decorated with small painted details everywhere. The in room safe was greatly appreciated. The hotel staff were excellent! Very helpful with my many questions. Always quick to help provide suggestions and solutions. It is a short walk to the train or tram which will then get you anywhere. It was close to many of the main tourist attractions of Istanbul but a steep uphill walk. The morning breakfast buffet was also excellent. Lots of choices and plenty of availability. Enjoyed my stay here immensely and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliaahoad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the rooms adequate. The staff were exceptionally welcoming and helpful. The buffet breakfast was good, and served in the terrace restaurant which had lovely views of both the Blue Mosque and The Bosphorus. The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from Topkapi Palace and all the other attractions in Sultanahmet and train and tram to other areas of the city, however, it was an uphill walk. Our 4 day stay was most enjoyable and we were glad we stayed at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KCBarry
Reviews.Content: Two couples last March stayed for three nights. It is a short walk up the hill the historic area with no need for a taxi. It's hidden away on a side street off the coastal highway and close to great restaurants to which we also walked, although there's always a taxi available. The narrow, winding streets can be a little confusing at first, but we wandered around at all hours and felt completely safe. The staff was very helpful when we had transportation problems getting to Goreme and would make calls for me at the front desk and connect me to the person with whom I needed to talk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BrOi2fun
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel at a very good location. So close to Sultanahmet. There are so many places to see around. The hotel personel is very helpful. See view is good from the 2. floor (1. floor doesn't see anything except an old city wall!).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant boutique hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe_Photography
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Armada for four nights and enjoyed our stay. It is a small hotel with nice furnishings in the lobby area. Our room was comfortable and had free internet in the room. The dining area is on the top floor with a great view of the Blue Mosque. The food was very good with a wide selection for the "free" breakfast. They also had a very nice lounge where we enjoyed drinks and did much of our internet. When we had to move to another hotel closeby (the Armada was fully booked), we went back to enjoy the very nice lobby and lounge. The hotel is close to almost everything and in a very nice area for walking or watching the river traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ssgtravel
Reviews.Content: Armada Hotel We wanted a hotel which was close to the airport, but because all of the hotels adjacent to the airport were really terrible, this hotel was chosen by our agent instead. It's not actually that close to the airport mileage-wise, but since it is just off a main highway, the airport is quickly reached by car. We were arriving on international flights and staying for just one night in Istanbul before taking off early in the morning for our tour of Turkey. Our room was fine; we did not have a view, but the bed was comfortable, the bathroom fine; there was a little street noise, but it didn't bother us. The room was supposedly non-smoking, but smelled a little when we arrived. We opened the window to air it out, and it was fine after that. The roof-top terrace looking out at the Blue Mosque on one side and the Marmara Sea on the other is beautiful; however, it was too cold for us to eat there. Our dinner inside at the restaurant was fine, albeit a bit pricey. However, it was nice to be able to eat in the hotel after our long flights, and the restaurant food was good and service quite attentive. Breakfast was the typical Turkish buffet with cereals, fruits, yogurt, salad stuff, breads, omelette, and delicious, freshly squeezed orange juice. Frankly, although we thought the Armada was fine for our purpose (being close to the airport, having a convenient restaurant at the hotel for our first night in Istanbul), I would not choose to stay here for a longer visit in Istanbul; there are much nicer, more authentic hotels closer to the sights than this one (see my review of Celal Sultan hotel). Having said that, you can certainly walk to the Blue Mosque and other sites nearby from this hotel, if you wish; there are numerous restaurants near-by, and the sea is just across the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rita P
Reviews.Content: I loved the room decor. Much more like staying in someone's home than a hotel - even down to area rugs on the floor. Service was great. The view from the roof garden/restaurant had water on one side, and the Blue Mosque on the other. The breakfast buffet was very good. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JimmiePaul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an early morning flight on our last day to stay at the Armada Hotel. The staff arranged for us to have coffee, tea and a wonderful selection of things to eat at 0230 in the morning. We have never experienced such a fine "send off" from a hotel in all of our travels. The roof-top restaurant has a beautiful view of the Bosporus and the hotel amenities were very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Armada is lovely”
Reviews.Author: joaquim c
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, good food. Confortable. Magnificent panorama.I am very happy for chosing Armada Hotel for me and my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: David908
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Excellent breakfasts very nice, comfortable rooms Hallways, and entrance to room, sometimes had an odor. Excellent service from staff and reception desk. I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Armada is Great!”
Reviews.Author: dicktheturk
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Armada in Istanbul. We'd go back. Nice place with some older world charm. Clean and pleasant. Very well located for everything you want Easy ten minute walk to Blue Mosque environs. Convenient for getting a taxi and being dropped off. Great breakfast included. Pre breakfast coffee/tea available by 6 am in the lobby. Ask for a room on the back side as the street side is a bit noisy at night with cars rumbling over the cobblestone street, and conversations on the front steps. Back side faces homes, is quiet and looks on Blue Mosque. Front desk service was good. Housekeeping superb.

Reviews.Title: “Happy To Recommend...”
Reviews.Author: rabbitBoston
Reviews.Content: We just returned to Boston from Istanbul. We found the Armada more than suited our needs. We liked the location, the roof top breakfast buffet buffet was extraordinary, our room was spotless, and the people at the front desk were very helpful. As Tulip the doorman would say when we asked him how he was doing : "Bomb-Bah-Gib-E"

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Bethdad
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Armada was on the third floor facing the harbor crammed with ships and, in the distance, the Bosporus, the busy waterway between Europe and Asia. The hotel is at the bottom of the hill where the Blue Mosque, Roman cistern, Topkapi Palace, Haggia Sophia Museum and other tourist and shopping attractions are located. A commuter rail stop is nearby making it easy and cheap to reach central city locations such as the Bosporus ferry dock, Grand Bazaar and the spice market. Our room was small but sparklingly clean and quiet. Dinner and breakfast are served on the hotel's fourth floor where an outdoor terrace affords views of both the Blue Mosque, which is breathtaking especially at night, and the harbor. My wife and I enjoyed breakfast there in late September and early October when the weather was warm but not hot. The food at the restaurant was better at breakfast than at dinner, in fact the morning buffet is outstanding featuring plates of fruit, cheeses, granola, fresh pastries, various egg dishes, copious amounts of fresh coffee, all restocked by an observant wait staff. Our two dinners were just average and the service on one occasion downright surly. We had a computer problem that Osman Baslamisli, of guest relations was able to solve thanks to his willingness to invest a great deal of his time. His colleague at the concierge desk, Ipek Sensilay, was courteous, knowledgeable and a delight to deal with. The front desk clerks were alert and helpful. All of the employees in guest relations spoke good English. This is not a chain hotel; it's in a real Turkish neighborhood where the observant visitor can see a genuine slice of Istanbul life including traffic tie-ups on the ancient narrow street the hotel fronts on just inside the ancient city walls.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous food!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth5591
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the old section of Istanbul has great roof top restaurants with views of the Bosphorus and the major mosques. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. If you are visiting the sights in the old city, this is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “G R E A T”
Reviews.Author: L J
Reviews.Content: After 20 years we decided to go back to Istanbul again. We wanted a hotel near the sea and close to the sights. The choice was quickly made after reading all the good reviews about the Armada hotel. We received a warm welcome and the service that the staff provided is great! The rooms are comfortable and clean, like the rest of the hotel. On the roof is a big terras, which is incredibly beautiful to enjoy your breakfast or dinner. The staff is very friendly and helps you with all kinds of problems and they give you good information if you want to go somewhere in the city. I recommend this hotel to anyone if you're going to stay in Istanbul All the expectations we had about this hotel are reached and the next time we definitley come back!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: mikimiki70
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is perfect, short walk distance to Blue Mosk and Hagia Sofia, historical part. Hotel interior is in oriental style, clean, perfectly maintanied. Hotel terace if offering magical stuning view on Blue Mosk and Hagia Sofia during dinner. Food for diner is perfect, both turkish traditional and sea food, sweet....Hotel staff, what to say, ready to fullfil any request, polite... Cordial recomendation

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: leyle
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at various other hotels in the old part of Istanbul, on our arrival at the Armada we first thought the location was perhaps a little out of the way, but were very pleased with our room with its charming decor, thoughtful touches (cool cotton bathrobes, a complimentary copy of the current Istanbul Time Out, natural oil soaps), immaculate bathroom, etc. The location proved to be fine - a real advantage in fact when using taxis as it so easily accessed without having to deal with the traffic snarls in some of the area's narrow streets. The view from the terrace is, as others have said, sensational and I loved the constantly changing view of the ships on the Sea of Mamara from our room. The lavish breakfast buffet set us up for the day each morning and the crisp white bedlinen, downy pillows and quiet area ensured a good night's sleep at the end of the day. Definitely a place to return to and recommend tp others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: eastcoaster66
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was very comfortable and clean with nice olive oil soaps and natural cotton bathrobes. The friendly, helpful staff spoke good English. The buffet breakfast was wonderful with a huge selection of fruit (fresh and dried), cereal, bread, home-made yoghurt, omlette and fruit juices plus tea and coffee. It was served in their roof top restaurant with fantastic views over the Bosphorus. We had a couple of evening meals in this restaurant at tables on the open air terrace overlooking night-time Istanbul with the illuminated Blue Mosque in full view and the suspension bridge which puts on a display of coloured lights every half an hour or so. The location is central so within walking distance of the main attractions. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: maisiehen
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for main sights. Comfortable pleasantly decorated rooms, with good practical bathrooms. Excellent communal spaces, especially the lobby and the terrace dining room, with sensational views of the sea and the blue mosque. Superb breakfast, with wide choice of unusual fresh and dried fruits. Attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a dream”
Reviews.Author: Reinhard Wolfga... R
Reviews.Content: We were two couples coming from North Cyprus, expecting just "a normal" hotel (which my wife Cath had booked in advance). What a nice surprise to find a friendly, clean, functional and, all together, very pleasant place with great breakfast performance on the roof terrace. We definitely will come back to the Armada

Reviews.Title: “Adequate location and facilities but indifferent attitude”
Reviews.Author: tdcCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Bosphorus in the Sultanahmet district. A short up hill walk to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque as well as the Sultanahment tram stop make this an acceptable location. The views from the rooftop breakfast room and Teras hotel boast fabulous Bosphorus views in one direction and fantastic Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia views in the other direction. Our "Superior" room was adequate with a newly renovated bathroom that looked good but provided inadequate hot water and inadequate water pressure. The front desk staff and doorman/security at the front door are highly indifferent and lack the warmth and friendliness that is evident throughout Turkey. All in all their website is accurate in its photographic representation of the hotel but oversells the hospitality aspect of their business.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Mt_Shavano
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights at the end of a three-week vacation to Turkey. All of the other hotels we stayed in were boutique-style and the Armada was much more of a standard hotel catering to the tourist trade. Our room was small, but efficiently laid out. It had two single beds with good matresses and comfortable down comforters. There was plenty of closet storage and the bathroom was well lit and quite functional. The breakfast buffet is served on the terrace which affords a stunning view of the Bosphorus River or the Blue Mosque, depending on which side of the room you're sitting in. The buffet itself was average, but offered a wide selection of foods. We had minimal interaction with the staff. I found them to be somewhat indifferent. The location is convenient to most of the tourist attractions in the old city and there are a number of very good restaurants within easy walking distance. The Arasta Bazaar is a couple of blocks away which afforded us with some last-minute shopping opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful Turkish Style”
Reviews.Author: MJLWinnetka_IL
Reviews.Content: Hold the loud and the glitzy and the unnecessary: the Armada is elegant. Quietly charming and immaculately clean, all systems are thoughtful and functioning. The hotel has a clientele that is as nicely mixed as the breakfast fruit salad and magically everyone values decorum. Incredible views of the city and the understanding, knowledgeable Staff work their gentle charms to make you feel that during your stay you belong here. The heat and the noise and the crowds fall away in the Armada and you beautifully re-charge. Thank you, Armada.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to visit old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: buciIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Istanbul, very convenient to visit Topkapi Muzeum, Blue mosque etc. I especially like the nice terrace with wonderful view and nice food. The decoration is also nice built to look like the old houses.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Janine255
Reviews.Content: The Armada came highly recommended by a friend. We stayed 4 days and the concierge, Osman, gave great suggestions for restaurants, boat excursions and more. The breakfast buffet is stunning, and we loved squeezing our fresh orange juice every morning. We lingered over breakfast gazing over the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque from the rooftop garden. It is so close to all the major sights in the old city. We had a great price for mid-August and were moved by our request to a seaside view room after 2 nights which had fabulous views. We would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, great service”
Reviews.Author: Jhybe J
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the rooftop terrace and the buffet breakfast. You can see aya sofia and the blue mosque nestled between different rooftops on one side, and the blue of the sea on the other. Gorgeous. The breakfast is an impressive spread of dried figs and cheese and fruits and honey straight from the comb and juice freshly pressed by your own hands. Yum. The rooms were clean and a fair size - I stayed at a much tinier space in the side of town near Taksim square before. And the fire escape stairway actually opened up to a lovely small garden which is a nice place to have a ciggy or fresh air :) The price is a little steep though, but since I didn't book this place on my own, can't comment on comparison with other hotels that might be similar in range. For organising meetings/workshops, the rooms were spacious, adequately equipped, constant supply of tea and coffee and little biscuits and best of all, windows you can open to let natural sunlight in. Overall, not a bad place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Armada Review”
Reviews.Author: Paolo S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite well located (not too far from main sites). Possibility of public transportation (train to main station) very close. In alternative, tramway from Sultanhamet square. The service is good. Almost everybody speaks a good English. The rooms are very clean and with the possibility of a nice view. The view from the terrace (used for breakfast, dinner or bar) is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Between the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Len S
Reviews.Content: Walking through the front door of the Armada hotel you step into an oasis of calm with a hint of musk in the air. The staff is "at your service" - friendly and helpful, there when you want them. We opted to upgrade our room for a view of the Bosphorus (an extra 50 euros a night), an extravagance perhaps, but a lovely room. They offered to install extra dark drapes for late sleeping and we accepted. Very nice linens, great shower, and very quiet, even though the Armada is close to Blue Mosque we were never awakened by the call to prayer. Breakfast on the rooftop is truly memorable - an extravagant feast with a 360 view of Istanbul where you will linger over coffee and watch the passing ships.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonestmatirome
Reviews.Content: This place has all,perfect location that is in the quite part of old town,fatntastic rooms with a lot comfort for a quality sleep, and great welcoming,very good service.you will love it.Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: mgdasu
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel is a pretty decent hotel....if you can find it! The hotel gave us wrong walking directions for the metro (left instead of right) which sent us on a 20 minute detour through the busy city with our luggage in 90 degree heat, so we didn't exactly arrive refreshed. Our flight from the US to Istanbul was overbooked and we ended up getting put on a flight a day later. I immediately sent Armada Hotel an email that was 24 hours in advance from the US, but they still made us pay for the night that we weren't there for. This was a dissapointing way to start our vacation. It seems like the hotel could have been a bit more hospitable and understanding. The beds are similar to sleeping on wood planks, but the bathroom was wonderful. Great hotel breakfast and great views. If you're walking to the hotel from the Metro and want correct directions, email me and I can send them to you!

Reviews.Title: “a charming oasis, fab location, fab breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Rebecca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights during celebrations for a friend's wedding. The hotel is charming, with old-fashioned decor, turtle pool in the lobby, birds upstairs in the terrace restaurant. We slept very comfortably and found the staff very helpful -- and the place was a steal, at least at Ramadan rates (68 Euros/night). More importantly, it is a two-minute walk from the waterfront and a five-minute walk from Sultanahmet Square, where Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are located (these can also be gazed at, along with the Bosphorus, from the terrace restaurant), and walking distance from Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar as well. Basically, staying here, you could see all the top sites in your guidebook and do your tourist shopping without ever resorting to taxis or public transport....though the latter can also be taken from Sultanahmet Square to anywhere else you might want to go. Finally, the breakfast that is included (and is served during the unusually civilized hours of 7:30-10:30am) is amazing! All kinds of cheese, olives, yogurt, fresh fruits, vegetables and herbs, egg dishes, dried fruit, pastries, etc., as well as real coffee and tea and an assortment of juices. All this is laid out in the terrace restaurant, where one can choose to sit inside or outside, either way with fantastic views of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Bosphorus. And across the street is another hotel restaurant, Giritli, which has amazing mezze.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to have stayed at the house to discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AminaParis
Reviews.Content: I just add to the description of the house that it is on 5 floors which was a surprise for us We enjoyed it but for some ppl it might be difficult We are impatient to come back !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Erik527
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the internet and were very pleasantly surprised about 1) the friendliness of the hotelstaff, 2) the cleanliness of the room and 3) the ideal location as far as walking to the old city centre is concerned. The hotel itself is located in a quiet neighbourhood, but within 5 minutes, the restaurant-, museum- and main attractions areas with all their hustle and bustle can be reached. The rooms are nicely furbished, minibar and coffee machine are available. Apart from perhaps a little more variety at the buffet breakfast, we have no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pgstahl
Reviews.Content: After reading may reviews and extensive research we chose the Armada Hotel. It was the perfect choice for us. Great location, great staff, great hotel. The breakfasts were substantial and the views from the terrace breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed very much staying in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela M
Reviews.Content: I spent a week-end in this hotel in August 2011; I had chosen it because of its location in the historical center of the city and also the traditional interior architecture. I wasn't disappointed, as the hotel is not far from the Aya Sofia and the interior decorations of the lobby and the rooms are very nice, reminding of old traditional Turkish style. Even if we did not take a room with a sea view, the windows opened to a very nice interior. The view from the top terrace is excellent - on one side, there is a sea view and on the other side, a view to Aya Sofia. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aliciafraser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with a friend. It was our first time to Istanbul. The Armada is centrally located in Sultanahmet and is close to everything! The breakfasts are worth skipping dinner for (except food in Istanbul is too delicious!) Super comfortable beds and great showers. Makes all the difference :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evjean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Armada as part of a tour, good location, close to Sultanhamet Square. - have to be somewhat careful in neighborhood at night. Rooms were very clean and charming, rooftop has excellent views of the City, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, nice to have drinks served on the roof top. Great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “a marvelous time in a marvelous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simin M
Reviews.Content: everything was perfect at Armada Hotel.It was one of the best hotel we stayed.Very friendly, very clean and an amazing breakfast! The very best was the atmosphere at Armada, which let us get an impression of turkey way of life; the reason we decided to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, friendly, great location.”
Reviews.Author: trish_stephens
Reviews.Content: The service received at Armada was very very good, reception was helpful and very friendly. Breakfast buffet offered a huge variety of food and you got to have breakfast on the terrace restaurant over looking the sea, which was a truly amazing start to your day. In the evening you can enjoy a meal at the restaurant, reasonably priced again the surroundings are breathtaking. Our room for two was nicely decorated and a good size. Also tea and coffee making facilities were a bonus. The location also is excellent a short walk to main tourist attractions. Overall we were very impressed with our stay and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: tripster44
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, it was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were a nice size. If you are looking for night life, I would NOT recommend this hotel, as it is in a quieter area of Istanbul. The location is very good if you want to be in close proximity to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, etc. I LOVED the breakfast buffet. The rooftop terrace was amazing and the breakfast was outstanding. The turtles in the lobby were cute as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for relaxation and sightseeing !”
Reviews.Author: dmtrspak
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and polite staff. Very nice decoration and furnitures, making you feel like in 1920's, but very well maintained. Especially the fragrance at the reception lobby will take you there. Very nice terrace with great view both ways, Bosporus entrance and Agia Sophia/Blue mosque. At walking distance from the majority of the Istanbul site seeings. Great variety in breakfast for all cultural habits. Not typically western buffet but very nice. Secured car parking and baby cot, both free of charge. Great choice for sight seeing with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good location within the city walls, access to tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: dignset
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent Turkish breakfast buffet in an open air terrace. Dined with views of the Bosphorus, Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque. Lobby filled with Ottoman antiques. Room had the amenities for a very pleasant stay. Mattresses are extra firm, but housekeeping can soften bed if requested. Cons: Noisy hotel on my Friday and Saturday night due to wedding party music til midnight on terrace. Hotel has 2 room floors and one can't escape party noise.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at Armada Hotel and would be very happy to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: dhood52
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from Armada Hotel (though uphill) to most tourist attractions, restaurants, cafes etc. Very friendly staff - great breakfast up on the roof terrace with wonderful views.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Topkapi”
Reviews.Author: fairfax425
Reviews.Content: This is a Turkish hotel, not an American chain! The large lobby is itself a prize-winning museum. The room is comfortable; the bathroom was just fine. Breakfast was an eye-opener, heavy on Turkish food tastes with enough to meet an American's needs. Its great advantage is being down the hill from the historic sites (we walked up to Topkapi Palace our last night for a concert) and only a block from the waterfront with excellent restaurants. Drinks at sunset on the rooftop terrace, with views of the domes and minarets of the Blue Mosque and Topkapi above us and the Sea of Marmara to the other side, were unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Armata Istanbul Rocks”
Reviews.Author: markgflanders
Reviews.Content: Hello, I was bowled over by the location of this hotel. The rooftop restaurant offered extraordinary views of downtown Istanbul. The restaurant menu choices throughout the hotel were outstanding, to say the least. Thanks, Mark G. Flanders Road Scholar Customer

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: LondonJAHone
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Armada several times over the past few years. It's in a great location for seeing the local sights with the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Grand Bazaar only a few minutes walk away. It's a lovely place, Ottoman styled. The beds are very comfortable with lovely bedding, the soaps in the bathroom are wonderful ( a daphine one and an olive oil one), the A/C works very well and the breakfast buffet is very good. The rooftop terrace (where breakfast and dinner is served) is wonderful with a view of the Bhosphorus on one side and the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia on the other side. The only negatives would be that the free wifi does not always work in the room and on the weekends in the summer, the terrace may not be available for dinner (due to weddings). I would only consider another hotel in Istanbul if the Armada was full (and then I'm sure we'd be disappointed)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: melindajirwin
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from Istanbul, and wanted to be sure to tell everyone what a great hotel for a reasonable price in Istanbul. We just did one night at the end of a cruise, but would definitely stay there again. It was just a block from the waterfront and a couple of blocks from the Blue Mosque in the heart of old town. Many restaurants, bars, shopping within easy walking distance. Rooms were clean, and bathrooms were well appointed. Even provided turkish robes during your stay. Probably the only bad thing I could say is the beds were a bit hard, but they say they would provide a cushion for the bed if requested. Rooftop terrace had awesome view of Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Less expensive than expected.”
Reviews.Author: splanknon
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for us and I thought it was going to cost me: they have their own parking garage (and they kept my key at the desk and made the transfer to the rental company), they have a delightful breakfast with a view from their terrace, they are in an Ottoman building which is lovingly restored, the room and bath were rather large and decorated well, the staff was attentive -- and the security man does stand outside by the car at night arranging for your picture to be taken. Very pleasant. When I went to pay the bill, I realized I had paid more for less elsewhere. I wish they had a concierge to help with arrangements -- sometimes I need to speak Turkish. they staff tried, but they were not too apprised.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for perfect city.”
Reviews.Author: GonzaloR4
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Big and ver very clean rooms. Amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner and the service was simply perfect, for example you can ask them to change your bed if you feel that it's too hard or too soft. Also, they told us lots of suggestions about places to visit, how to move on the city, restaurants, etc... In conclusion. Perfect hotel to stay on the marvelous city called Istambul

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the terrace is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: WarwickKingmaker
Reviews.Content: Hotel - excellent location, with views of the Blue Mosque from your bedroom, helpful service and a great base for the Old City, but the highlight is the terrace, being able to see one of the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia and the Bosphorus while eating berakfast of when drinking in the evening would have been special - but to see all three was sublime.

Reviews.Title: “I make one or two visits a year to Istanbul and always stay at the Armada. It is the most hospitable ,friendly .”
Reviews.Author: putto1924
Reviews.Content: Each visit is always wonderful I am greeted with hospitality and kindness. The staff is always helpful . The food is the best. I recommend the Armada to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: bellaPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: If you don't want 5 star and the full glitz & glamour (& why would you want to in Istanbul) then look no further. Fabulous location, amazing breakfast, great dinner location on rooftop, very clean roomy rooms etc. etc. We stayed for 5 nights to meet up with our small group tour of Turkey & wanted for nothing more. The reception staff went over & beyond when we arrived very early at 6am & had us in our room(with a view of the Blue Mosque) by 9.30am.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robgale1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 days at the end of June. For tourists the location is great as it is a pleasent 10-minute walk to the Blue Mosque, hippodrome and other attractions. We found the staff very helpful, and most speak good english. The rooftop restaurant serves good food, with beautiful views uphill to the Blue Mosque, and in the opposite direction an excellent view over the Bosphorus. Although we did not use it, the hotel has a garage next to it, with easy access to the highway that runs along the water.

Reviews.Title: “Much Enjoyed! esp. the great overview on the rooftop!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MahmudtheGreat
Reviews.Content: Overwhelming Location of the Hotel we loved most! Great Breakfast View to ships on Bosporus and on backside see the Blue Moschque and the Fascinating Hagia Sophia!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug32989
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The location is in Old Town, just inside the old city walls. It has wonderful views of thewaterfront in one direction and the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the other, all of which you can see from a very pleasant rooftop Terrace restaurant/bar. Everything of interest in Old Town is within easy walking distance of the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, and the newer ones are beautifully appointed. The breakfast buffet is extensive, and you can squeeze your own fresh orange juice (as much as you want!) every morning.

Reviews.Title: “First time Stop over for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: benrose
Reviews.Content: A very friendly and comfortable stay in a convenient position, close to the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and I would strongly recommend it to friends.”
Reviews.Author: annalena025
Reviews.Content: Perfect service, beautiful terrace and lobby area, functioning business center, smiling staff and the best breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the wrong side of the tracks in a good way...”
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel is located in a unique area, actually a bit on the other side of the tracks from Sultanhamet and all the sights...about 10-15 minute interesting walk will bring you to the heart of the historical area. The immediate area of the hotel is very run down but not dangerous at all...lots of local charm with apartments,small food shops etc. Also a few very nice restaurants close by...I think over time the whole area will be restored. Armada hotel seems to cater to groups mainly tourist and educational conference types but certainly many individual travelers too. We stayed in the Annex called Stablesgate which is just around the corner. It is an apartment on many floors including a terrace with stunning views including the Blue Mosque. It is impossible to describe sitting on the terrace with all the sights, smells and sounds of Istanbul!! The call to prayer would echo from mosque to mosque and indeed you know and feel you are in another world. The annex is very private and homelike, well furnished and very very clean. We really liked it and probably the only complaint would be all the stairs...there are actually four floors including the terrace and they are steep. The street life just outside your door includes multiple families and the kids all play all day in the street well into the early evening. We found it all charming...some might find it a bit noisy but things quiet down about 11pm. This property can be booked directly with the hotel...Mr. Nadim was very helpful in answering all my questions or Exclusive Escapes also books this annex called Stablesgate. There are also two other studios but honestly I'm not sure where they were. Since we were there for 5 nights this apartment really felt like home and I would highly recommend it. The breakfast at the Armada terrace was very nice and while typically Turkish, there were enough items to have something for everyone's taste including freshly squeezed orange juice. We ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant on the terrace with the most stunning views and the food was very good. Service throughout the hotel was efficient and professional.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was still there.”
Reviews.Author: BirdloverBayArea
Reviews.Content: I felt I was really in Turkey and in a lovely, peaceful setting in the heart of old Istanbul. I was not in a generic hotel that could be anywhere. It is charming and unique with wonderful service. I loved the restaurant with its views of Istanbul, the Bosphorus, and the Sea of Marmara, It seemed as though I could touch the Blue Mosque from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in EVERY way!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelsOregon
Reviews.Content: Clean and cozy rooms, helpful staff, supurb breakfast buffet in a covered terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara, outdoor dining for lunch and dinner with the same fabulous view, and finally the hotel is within easy walking distance of The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. I will happily return to the Armada Hotel on future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Armada- Stablesgate annexe”
Reviews.Author: HenryWorthing
Reviews.Content: For us the location was perfect. Away from the hustle and bustle of the main Sultanamhet tourist area but within an easy walking distance of all the main attractions. The annexe is just around the corner from the main hotel where breakfast was taken on the roof terrace. As the weather was extremely pleasant we had the added advantage of eating on the outside terrace with wonderful views of the coming and going on the Bosphorus. The breakfast whilst not wildly exciting was more than adequate with enough variety to satisfy. The annexe apartments are comfortable with the advantage of being able to make a cup of tea whenever we wanted and with its own roof terrace to enjoy the views. If you wanted to, you could in fact cook in these apartments but with the restaurant prices so reasonable we did not find it necessary to do that. The gound floor apartment does smell a little of cat spray on the lower level ( it is on 2 floors) but having said that, Istanbul must be cat spray capital, as it is noticable as you walk around the city! We did not find this particularly off putting, just an observation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurence1910
Reviews.Content: I staid there for business. Armada is very well located. The rooms are clean and the restaurant ( on the roof with a wonderful view on the sea) offers high quality food (at breakfast you can have fresh orange juice). The people at the reception are very friendly and do all they can to satisfy the customer. If I had to mention a negative point I would say that the soundproofing could be beter (you can hear the call for pray of the mosque early morning when the sun rises up).

Reviews.Title: “Charming scenic stay!”
Reviews.Author: daniellebduffy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Armada Hotel in Istanbul twice now for conferences. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and clean. The breakfast is one of the best in the city - with beautiful views of the Marmara Sea, Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque. The hotel is impeccably clean and the staff is very helpful and welcoming. I would highly recommend staying at the Armada if you want to see the sites Sultanahmet - which are a short uphill walk away.

Reviews.Title: “The Armada Hotel is charming!”
Reviews.Author: PattymaeChicago
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Armada and this time I brought my husband and another couple. We all loved the hotel: the ambience, the service, and the clean, comfortable rooms. All the staff did everything possible to meet our needs and desires the entire week we stayed with them. They were always available to answer any of our questions regarding the city and how to get somewhere. The location of the hotel is perfect! We will definitely stay at the Armada on our future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda61
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Armada, it wasn't the "cheapest" Istanbul option, but it was worth every penny. Bedroom spacious, comfortable and immaculate, lovely view of the sea. Breakfast terrace has stunning views and a terrific choice and range of - always fresh - food. Staff could not have been more helpful when asked anything on any topic, cleaning staff did a superb job every day. Location is terrific, as stated before it's very very near to several major "must-sees", and for a reasonably large hotel everywhere was quiet and peaceful. Can recommend very very highly indeed

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for small room with view of hanging laundry, but great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Dinnerout66
Reviews.Content: A mix of fine and not so fine. Visually splendid Turkish vegetarian buffet breakfast on top floor with stunning view of the water and playful wild dolphins. I was on my own in a standard room, with view of neighborhood hanging laundry. Was hoping to stay for a full seven days, and tried to negotiate a better price (238 euros per night for approx about 23 m2!) with the web reservations manager, but he was quite offhand and refused to discuss more than a token discount. And there's no exercise area at all. Better deal at the Best Western Premier Regency Suites & Spa up the road which was superb and well located on Akbiyik Cad.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: rik2011
Reviews.Content: The Armada hotel proudly shows off its Tripadvisor average of 4.5 at the reception and they have every right to. Perfectly located near the Blue Mosque and 2 minutes away from Istanbul backpacker's heaven, the Armada hotel is the perfect for demanding travelers, who do not wish to end up in one of the typical chain hotels. Design wise, you're walking straight into a 1900 Ottoman setting, just to give you that Oriental feel without falling into the usual visual nightmare. Rooms are charming, with a stunning view on the old walls, with the sea in the background. Magic. Do not miss dining at the terrace overlooking the old city. Obviously, all this comes at a price of 160 euros ... but at least, you'll enjoy every penny of it. nice! r

Reviews.Title: “an achieve goal, a must before you die.”
Reviews.Author: Ancon29
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is location, the traffic around the old city is terrible, if you go to Istanbul for a few days is a must to stay in the old city, if not you will spend lots of your precious time getting in and out. Just getting out of your hotel and walking for 3-5 m to be IN the center of all the beauties was the best. Your terrace is amazing, the views incredible.

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean hotel with excellent service in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: mitzisydney
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 nights here. The rooms were pristine and comfortable. The buffett breakfast was excellent with an extensive variety of foods including halva and turkish delight! The hotel was slightly off the main drag with a short walk to plenty of restaurants and all the historical sights. Free Wi Fi. It was only 8 degrees outside and the hotel was lovely and warm, we did not have to use any extra heating in the room at all. We would definitely stay again and can highly recommend it. Ask for the rooms from the 2nd floor facing the sea,, the view was spectacular. It is also a lovely walk along the sea towards the harbour from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel near the most attractive historic spots”
Reviews.Author: ikuka
Reviews.Content: All the receptionists spoke excellent english and friendly. We asked them some advises about sightseeing and they proposed correct information and gave us suggestions with patience. Also they handled all our demands efficiently. The room was a little small for three persons but very clean and confortable. Our room was at the second floor. We could see the beautiful Marmara sea out of the window. I like their hand-made soap. The shower was quite modern. They provided bathrobes and it made my friends feel relaxed. As we were two women and one man, there were two red bathrobes and one blue. Although I could see that they prepare our arrive carefully, there were only two cups and two glasses. So we told the luggage service staff and the other staff brought us immediately. The breakfast was traditional Turkish style. It was really agreable to have breakfast with beautiful view. The staffs of restaurants in the evening were all super friendly and attentive. We went there every nights for dinner or wine. They received us just like welcome their friends. We all had a great time. A hotel with good service and near the main important historic spots in Istanbul. We walked only few minutes to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Strongly recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marylindaportugal
Reviews.Content: We have had a very pleasent stay at this hotel,located perfectly in the very nice part of the historacal penisula very close to sea side and to the most historical places in the old town,breakfast bufet on the roof was amazing,very good staff was very helpful,highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “a great town visit”
Reviews.Author: blaupetergolfer
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very central to the best old views of Istanbul - the hotel is very good - service at its best - rooms are clean + faithful - the restautant is good

Reviews.Title: “I've really enjoyed staying in Armada”
Reviews.Author: ruziya
Reviews.Content: good location, good service, delicious cuisine, comfortable conditions

Reviews.Title: “restrained, seemless service & Hotel security: best hotspot to explore historial Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Gamandergasse
Reviews.Content: great service, all wishes were fullfilled (+ birthday surprise); lovely and cozy room for 2 persons on decade birthday trip best place to explore historical Istanbul service and personal behaves restrained, but always on your service if you need it friendly security in front of the Hotel door

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: iashraf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honey moon in August 2008. The hotel price has gone up since, at the time we booked as package with flights from Expedia. We arranged a taxi from the airport who also picked us up on return - it was about half an hours drive or so. The sea is just across the road from the hotel, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are walking distance - less than 10 minutes but you will need to walk up the hill. The restuarants are also near by. The hotel served nice breakfast on the terrace from which you can see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and also the sea, get up there before the breakfast closing time otherwise you will be annoying the staff - trust me you don't want to be there! The terrace opens as a restaurant in the evening - but it was very pricey! The rooms are clean and spacious, TV, fridge and coffee making facilities available - the fridge was stocked up with drinks and snacks, we didn't realise that the fridge would be checked on checking out so we had to pay for the one or two things that we had consumed. Fast food outlets like McDonalds, Burger King and Pizza hut are available near the blue mosque as well as cafe's and restuarants. The grand bazaar is also closely located near the Blue mosque. The hotel is close to the train station which takes you to the point where you can catch aboat to go to Kadikoy - the asian side of Istanbul. If you are muslim, there are plenty of mosques around to pray. There was one in the same street as the hotel which was very convenient. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would stay again if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: PHR67
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just one block from the Marmara Sea, and short walk up the hill to all the major sites in the historic section of Istanbul. The staff is very friendly and service-minded, and the roof terrace restaurant is great, with a fabulous view over the Marmara Sea. My room was a little bit on the small side, but very comfortable, with free wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality, warm & friendly atmosphere, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vezir
Reviews.Content: Armada is beyond comparison the best of more than 10 hotels we have stayed at in Istanbul. That's why we return time after time, for business or pleasure. It not only gives value for money, but also adds value to the entire experience of our Istanbul visits.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Shsasha
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I stayed here - every time for a conference, with a large group of people. The hotel was the center of our "life" in Istanbul as we slept here, worked here and ate here. For a relatively small size "conference hotel" they are doing a superb job - great, helpful and very professional staff, clockwork efficient, and you still feel very private there. The way it's set us as a mini- Ottoman court adds all the color and ambience. The greatest thing for conferences is that it's all-natural materials, homestyle refreshments, nothing overbearing, unlike most other places that "wrap" you in plastic. Nothing relaxes you better in the break or in the evening than watching slow and wise turtles - a dozen of them - go about their busy lives in the fountain in the lobby. The food is highest quality, all natural and inventive menue, with great views to the Sea of Marmara and to the pinnacles of Sultanahmet. And great comfortable beds. Easy walk to the "happening" places - about two blocks uphill and you are in the restaurant- and bar-packed neighborhood, another two blocks and you are at Sultanahmet square, or by the Topkapi palace. So highly recommend - to groups and individuals alike!

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Enjoy Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Emilioula
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents all you want to have outside your home and your country. Cozy, warm, welcoming, clean, comfortable, and nicely situated within the city. Pop your head out of your hotel room and you may be gazing at the minarets of the Blue Mosque or at the light redness of Haghia Sophia. As the hotel offers a choice of rooms and studios, we actually opted for a studio. We stayed in Studio 2 and we found it simply amazing and very close to the hotel proper, with its reception and breakfast. The furniture is in perfect Turkish style, with carpets, curtains, and Ottoman window where the bed is located. Books on Turkey, Istanbul, and newspapers/magazines on what's going on in the city are offered for your consultation on the desk. Plus, soft bathrobes are available in every room. The studios, as the rooms, are cleaned everyday. The breakfast (and restaurant) is a major highlight of this hotel. Perfectly included in your room price, it involves a long (LONG) table full of every sort of Turkish delicacy, including tea, fresh orange juice, pomegranate juice, hot and cold plates typical of the local cuisine, fruit salads, cheeses, honey in the honeycomb, and even local dried fruits. In the summer it takes place in the breathtaking terrace with view of the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia, where enchanting calls to prayers can be heard. During the winter and spring, the beautiful restaurant room on the roof, with large windows, offer comfort, warmth, and, besides the Blue Mosque, even a nice view of the seaside. What more can you desire? The personnel is very polite and very helpful. The cost, considering what the hotel actually offers, is definitely not too high. We fell in love with Istanbul and, we think, this hotel had its part in enhancing our perspective of the city. We would definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “nice for business, great for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Giroclone
Reviews.Content: With its stunning view from its terrace, Armada Hotel is for sure one of the best hotels in Istanbul thanks to its incredible location. You will enjoy the view of the Blue Mosque and Santa Sofia during breakfast, lunch or dinner from the terrace restaurant. Rooms are comfortable and nicely arranged and staff always ready to warmly help you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Franverdi
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to go to this hotel by a Turkish friend who comes from Istanbul, and I now understand why. This hotel not only has beautiful interiors, it is located in the heart of old Istanbul, and is obviously an important part of the city. So many hotels nowadays could be anywhere, but the Armada is clearly an Istanbul institution: the furniture, the paintings on the walls, the carpets, even the wood used and the olive soap provided, not to mention the amazing breakfast buffet, could not be anywhere but in this city. The staff at this hotel were really outstanding in every respect: friendly, attentive, and provided everything we needed, when we needed it, and with a warm smile. The food at the hotel was also excellent. The breakfast buffet was truly amazing (about 50 different items available, until 10:30 a.m. every morning), but dinner in the top restaurant was excellent as well. And having been to some of the other high end restaurants in Istanbul during our stay, I can say that the Armada's food was both excellent value for money and amongst the best meals I had there. Again, the service was superb. The room we had was one of the hotel's top end rooms, and we felt it was worth every penny. Spatious, beautiful, great view of the Bosphorous, a huge bathroom with excellent shower, and a bowl of free fruit left for us every day. All the main sights of Istanbul, as well as some of the best evening haunts, are within walking distance of this hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel extremely highly. I had one of the best stays I have ever had there.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and authentic hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: blandine66
Reviews.Content: A very good location for this hotel which mix turkish atmosphere and comfort. Perfect services and marvelous breakfasts! To recommand without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Near the highlights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Karlevi
Reviews.Content: A hotel with very good location and splendid breakfast on the roof terrace with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cosy hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AletaSerbia
Reviews.Content: I did not choose this hotel by travellers' reviews, but because backgammon tournament which we attended was held there. However, I was pleased upon reading the nice reviews of other hotel guests, which proved to be more than true upon our arrival! The hotel is located very conveniently, you can reach all the historical monuments very quickly (and for other attractions over the Golden Horn you can catch tram in front of a Blue Mosque) and sleep in silence at the same time. Hotel staff was very kind and helpful, especially in the restaurant where we had dinner almost every evening (which is not exactly our style but the food was delicious and the view over Marmara sea upon Asian side was unbeatable in the neighborhood!). Hotel is decorated in a traditional style with interesting "museum-like" exhibits from Turkish tradition in the lobby. What was for me the most important was immaculate cleanness in the room and in the entire hotel, as well. Breakfast was also excellent with full variety of food (scrambled eggs, different kind of cheese, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, but most delicious was American coffee, the best I tested in hotel ever!). The only downsides were: very firm bed, wireless internet wasn't working properly the whole time, the view from our room was not ""romantic",in fact we were facing the part of the restaurant and a kind of winter garden with wreck houses behind. However, we didn't spend too much time in the room, so it is only an observation: ask for the room overlooking the sea. I will definitely spend my time again in this hotel if I visit Istanbul next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisbonRudi
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, hard mattress but you can ask the reception to soften it. AC quite hot which was good according to the weather. Robes and slippers are available. Toilet was large and clean. The breakfast was excellent with a lot of different choices of Turkish products. The reception staff is very friendly and helpful. At the hotel entrance thereâ€™s always a security guard. Wasnâ€™t a problem for us but the main restaurant area (tourist) is up the hill. Tips about Istambul: If you want to visit the basilicaâ€™s cistern go there as 9 am (when itopens), otherwise it will be queues to get inside. Visit also the Sultanâ€™s mausoleums between Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace (free entrance). Go to the Spice Bazaar and walk to the Grand Bazaar. All area itâ€™s a street market where you can buy the same things youâ€™ll find in the grand bazaar for less money. If you want to take a boat cruise in the Bosforo you have two options: With IDO (boat company) takes around 6 hours. Take the boat in Eminonu Harbour (Youâ€™ll be in Anadolu Kavagi â€“ near Black Sea for 3 hours before taking the boat back); With TurYol, take the ferry in Eminonu (after Galata Bridge).Itâ€™s a 1h30 boat trip with no stops for 10TL (5â‚¬).This one only takes you to Ataturk Bridge and back. The Ataturk Airport has a tight security (you have a police control at the entrance before check in) and the usual one before the gates. If your flight is at a busy hour it can take a while to get to the gate. Take this in mind when planning the transfer to the airport by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: EdelBrid
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel situated in the old part of Istanbul which I would recommend highly. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is atmospheric. I was here on business; the staff were helpful with printing & scanning documents, posting letters and providing information when requested. There is free wi-fi in the rooms and in public areas - it is usually Ok but sometimes it's not possible to connect. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Breakfast is self-service and excellent and served in a roof-top restaurant with great views over the Bosphorus. The restaurant also has good albeit expensive dinner options at night. There is a mini bar in the room and the usual amenities. They also provide unusual Turkish soap made from olive oil. (Bring hair conditioner though.) If staying here, you are not near the metro line, so will have to get taxis or walk to your destination. All in all, a great option for tourists or business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: HJStockholm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Armada hotel in March of 2010. The hotel was beautiful. There is even a fountain with turtles in the lobby. Rooms were excellent. We had an inner room and it was quiet. The breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant located on the roof was amazing. So much food to choose from and all delicious. On one side of the roof you have a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and Haga Sofia. On the other side is a wonderful view of boats on the Bosphorus. Staff was very helpful with transportation to the airport. Cheaper than a regular taxi. The only drawback was the area. The hotel is superb but some nearby buildings are in very bad shape. A bit confusing walk to get places but if you have a map or ask the staff you should have no problem. About a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest train station.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable break in one of the most remarcable spots in Europe”
Reviews.Author: MichailProuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just five minutes away of the Sultanahmet Square, giving the visitor the ability to admire two magnificent buildings (Aghia Sophia and Sultanahmet Mosque), at one glance, from the exquisite terrace of the hotel. Ideal for the visitor who intends to spend some time at the historical peninsula of Istanbul. Within walking diastance from the Topcapi Palace and the Kapali Carsi, the famous Istanbul market.

Reviews.Title: “A nice character hotel with a friendly atmosphere and a warm charm.”
Reviews.Author: erlestoke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet location just off the main road into Istanbul and close to the railway station and a number of important historical sites. It is well situated to visit the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Basilica cistern, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market. The restaurant was pleasantly situated on the top floor of the hotel giving lovely views of the sea as well as the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya whilst eating breakfast. We had an evening meal there which was pleasant but not outstanding. The rooms were comfortable and kept very clean. Overall I would use the hotel again especially if visiting european Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “A place top feel home”
Reviews.Author: Pelemettmann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is colse to the main attractions of Istanbul, all in walking distance. The first impression when chdcking in is the very friendly and competentvstaff in hotel. To sum up: rooms, service, food are excellent and ankes we wish to coeme back again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place I would stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cornwall-brady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Armada 3 different times throught Dec 2010 and Jan. 2011. Every detail of the motel is consistant in the way they treat their guests. We traveled all over Tr. and this was definetly a place I looked forward to coming back to. My last stay in Jan. was solo. I felt very comfortable and the staff were wonderful in helping me with taxis, currency exchange, and any other kind of information I asked them for. They have good wireless service and the rooms are so cozy. We stayed in some expensive motels during my visit but by far the Armadas beds were the most comfortable of any. The breakfast is something you just can't miss. Thank you Armada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and outstanding breakfast”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. It is a perfect location for visiting the old town of Istanbul. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The buffet breakfast is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Armada is a cozy, old-fashion hotel with a very friendly staff, who was always helpful in all questions.”
Reviews.Author: Arja2511
Reviews.Content: It was my second time at this hotel. I felt very pleased, when the doorman obviously rememberd me when I arrived. That is excellent service. The 3rd floor restaurant is very nice with good breakfast and tasty dinners. The view there is just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull and positive experience”
Reviews.Author: bma22
Reviews.Content: Regarding the room I appreciated the combination of comfort and eye for detail with local tturkish traditional products like the soap. The breakfast was astonisihing, not only in view of the choice and comnbination of flavours and products, but also and especially because of the wonderfull location on the terrace with a sublime view. The rates in the bar I thought were a bit elevated, especially in view with the availibility of bars on the square in the direct surrounding of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for business or leisure traveler”
Reviews.Author: Jetblast25
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at Armada. Accolades across the board. Very convenient to get to from the airport, Fabulous breakfast and incredible views from the dining roonm and especially from the rooftop patio. Rooms are not big but very comfortable. Free wireless. I attended a corporate event there and the hotel staff were very helpful assisting with our AV, etc. No complaints. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfasts & Best Guest Relations Service”
Reviews.Author: flamen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a house near the hotel and our rental included complimentary breakfasts on the superb rooftop terrace with views across the sea and (behind) the Blue Mosque. Breakfasts were the best we had in a period of ten weeks through England, Scotland, France, Italy, Austria, Hungary, Romania and Bulgaria. The restaurant manager was outstanding-he should be given a rapid promotion at the Armada or elsewhere. We also benefited from the service provided by Mr Osman, Guest Relations. Mr Osman has a comprehensive knowledge of Istanbul and he was of great assistance to us on several occasions. We thoroughly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel. Great breakfast but rest average for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Romjust001
Reviews.Content: What i liked most was the breakfast under the roof veranda. Rest was ok but the size of the rooms is relatively small ! Price quality ratio average.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from rooms under the kitchen”
Reviews.Author: tennis_tourist
Reviews.Content: Room 221 had a lovely view looking out over the water, a nice walk-in shower and was clean and airy. Unfortunately none of that matters much if you are being kept awake till 1am from the bangs and crashes coming from above.
