When I called downstairs to reception to mention this, I found out that really nothing can be done. I came down in person to ask the person manning the desk to make a note on the computer about this issue, but even this simple thing was ignored, as I found out the next morning. When checking out I was offered 10% off my airport transfer, which was basically a joke - the price of a chocolate bar in the mini-bar. (on this issue, don't be ignorant like I was and pay the hotel's price, google it and you will find the same service available for 20â‚¬, half their price). The man at reception told me to email the hotel which I have done, and of course there has been no reply. So, although others have obviously had a nice stay, I was unlucky enough to be stuck below the kitchens, and therefore cannot recommend this hotel to anyone, not only for the issue itself but just as much for the extremely poor way it was handled. Apparantly it's ok to be inconvenienced if you have taken advantage of the special offer shown on their website. Their staff have a great deal to learn about customer service, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!! Rooms, service, food and location are really great!!!”
Reviews.Author: NathalieR6
Reviews.Content: The rooms overlooking the Blue Mosque and those overlooking the Bosphorus are really very nice!!! Breakfast is a FEAST in itself!!! And the best part of it, is that it's located on the terrace.... amazing view all around!!!!!!! I highly recommend it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stablesgate House Annex is TOTALLY worth it.”
Reviews.Author: georgelavin
Reviews.Content: My brother, his partner, a friend of ours and I stayed at the Stablesgate House Annex (run by The Armada Hotel) in the Sultanahmet district of Ä°stanbul. I fell in love with the house online when I ran a search for places to stay in the historic district. No matter what other properties I looked at, this one kept calling my name. The pictures of the views from the terrace were so enticing! My brother and his partner arrived on 01 November around 15:30 and checked in before I did. I landed about 90 minutes after they did and, subsequently, checked in that much later. When getting to the house, I felt like I was on the "Real World Ä°stanbul" ... running to get there first to pick the best room. Now, the house is on a little side-street away from the hotel. As one in our party put it, "it's the corner of Down-And-Out and Up-And-Coming." But, you ARE living on a street with people and families who have lived there for a long time. You are communing with the local population. That was a definite plus in our book. The house is akin to a row house in NYC. It is very narrow (width-wise), but it is tall. It has five levels. Street level is the living room with the TV and a full bathroom with shower. The lower level is where the kitchen, dining table and washer/dryer are located. The first level up is a mater bedroom with full-/queen-sized bed and en-suite bathroom. The second level is identical to the first (except the dÃ©cor is a bit different). And finally, the last level is that of the terrace: broken down into a glassed-in terrace and an outdoor terrace. The terrace alone is worth the price of admission. I kid you not. You have a stunning view of the Sea of Marmara, the Golden Horn (and BeyoÄŸlu) and less than 500 m. from you ... the Sultan Ahmet Camii (The Blue Mosque) and the Aya Sofya (Hagia Sophia). As mentioned previously, the house is on a narrow side-street a few minutes' walk from the entrance to the Hotel. If there was an entrance in the rear of the Hotel, you'd be inside the Hotel in a matter of seconds. Unfortunately, this is not the case, and you have to circle the hotel ... often finding yourself trying to not get run over by the traffic that circulates on AhÄ±rkapÄ± Sokak. The breakfasts at the Hotel's Teras (Terrace) were divine. No cold cuts, but almost everything else under the sun. The one complaint ... the bees. There are bees everywhere. And, one of the mornings we were there, one of us in the party saw a bee sting one of the other patrons. Not sure how often this happens, but I'm sure more than not. So, if you are allergic to bee stings ... be careful. The staff at Teras was magnificent; very friendly, very warm, very quick to get what you needed. The staff at the hotel, however ... The hotel staff (front desk and bellboys) was another matter altogether. They were never rude ... but they were never friendly, either. They were cold, aloof, and seemed put-off a lot of the times. Maybe it had something to do with that most of the staff's English abilities were limited (or they made it seem that way so as to not be bothered). Now, don't get me wrong ... English is not the only language any one of us speaks (some of us speak English, Spanish, French and Italian), but when working in a tourist-destination hotel, one should ensure that the staff is more than just "basic knowledge" English. The one exception was the Concierge -- he was always very willing to help us, was always very helpful when giving information, spoke English beautifully and had a friendly demeanor. Housekeeping did a magnificent job of maintaining the room clean. No complaints there. MAJOR COMPLAINTS: 1. The full-sized sofa bed and sofas that convert to twin-sized beds are the WORST ever. The sofa bed is about as comfortable as sleeping on jagged rocks. The other sofas are minimally better than that. If the House Annex is being sold as a space where SIX people can sleep comfortably, then they should make sure that the beds on the living room floor are comfortable. 2. The hotel has WiFi throughout the lobby, the Teras and, I'm sure, in the rooms. The hotel, however, DOES NOT have WiFi in the House Annex ... something we all found very annoying. Every time we wanted to keep in touch or see what was going on in the world, we'd have to get up and go to the Hotel. 3. On our last night, the fire brigade came and shut off the power to our street because there was a threat of a fire. Understandable in such an old neighborhood. The hotel had a generator that kept them up-and-running. The house annex didn't even have working emergency lights. When I called the front desk to find out what was going on, they were less than helpful and seemed like they couldn't care less. All in all, the place is magnificent. I would go back to Ä°stanbul in a second ... would have to think about going back to the Armada Hotel (would not have to think about going back to the House Annex if there was WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Functional and clean”
Reviews.Author: Elsailor
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good rooms with plenty of room. location is ok, you need to walk a little to get to the main attractions. It is on the old part of town. Breakfast is really good!

Reviews.Title: “Armada is a charming, well-located hotel in the historical district.”
Reviews.Author: worldadventurer7072
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Armada. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were nicely furnished with everything we needed, and the hotel was located near the historical sites so that we easily walk to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and many restaurants. We will definitely stay at the Armada when we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and proximity in a deluxe setting.”
Reviews.Author: Tenighir
Reviews.Content: What first impressed us was our room: coffee and tea available at no charge and at our convenience, comfy Turkish cotton bathrobes, slippers, and space to stretch out. Then we went to the restaurant and enjoyed spectacular views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia on one side and the water traffic on the sea on the other. The turtles in the lobby add charm; the front desk is always helpful, and the Radio Bar serves great little "munchies" to accompany pre-dinner drinks. Because of the Armada's location, we could hop on rail and tram lines, or explore the old city on foot. The Armada had everything we could want, and served us with little extra touch that made our visit to Istanbul a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but careful of rooftop weddings”
Reviews.Author: TrailFindersCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of clients and everyone seemed to find the hotel adequate for their needs. Even though it is near the main road it is secluded enough so as to avoid traffic noice. But the hotel is popular with wedding groups and the outdoor rooftop is used many nights for noisy wedding parties, but luckily the parties end at a reasonable hour. Nice lobby and bar area. Rooftop breakfast area looks out on Hagia Sofia and the Sea of Marmara. Staff in the restaurant are a bit indifferent but OK overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: brytom
Reviews.Content: Overall good and friendly service, excellent breakfast with a nice view from the roof terrace. I joined a conference and stayed 3 nights in Armada . Room was little bit small but very clean and stylish designed. Bathroom modern and very clean. I would expect lower price in November. Location is near Blue Mosque and TopKapi - necessary to step up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Armada Hotel for Tango festival and everything was just great. People were very friendly. Location is fantastic, close to all historical sites. I highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely homy enviroment ,Excelent and inmediate service”
Reviews.Author: GIURELLA
Reviews.Content: The receptionist gave us a room with half view to the ocean, eventhough we had only paid room with view at the city. We thought the air conditioning was not working and in less than a minute they were in the room fixing our ignorance. we asked for an extra blanket and they send a delicious crispy clean comforter. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. you dididnt know were to start. the food for dinner was awasome 5 star restaurant. the vew at thr resatauran was splendid either way , to the ocean or to the old town. But the cherry on the cake was the concierge ""ozzy"" he went all the way in having all the answers and solution to our requests. Giving advice so we would not get ripped of by taxis, or sales people. recomending restaurants , relaxing massages and turkish baths and even planing your tours. you dont need to plan ahead your tours , you only need to be at least 15 days to really enjoy turkey. i cant wait to go back I loved the location it was at the entrance of the old city ,were all the atractions are. also i preferred the turkish decoration and enviroment to a very modern hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: illinoisjack
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very clean. Breakfast and dinner on the rooftop was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great service, and excellent value for price.”
Reviews.Author: LJS0401
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, all staff were extremely helpful and polite. The room was very nice but parts of it looked a little worn. The breakfast was absolutely outstanding and so healthy. When I come back to Istanbul I definitley want to stay at the Armada again. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mbrinkley3
Reviews.Content: The Armada is a smallish personal hotel with wonderful service in an excellent location. I always try to stay in a hotel with a rooftop restaurant and this one may be the best i have ever seen. The Bosphorous on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other, up the hill. We enjoyed the hotel's restaurant and view so much that we ended up eating most of our meals there--just captivated by the views. The food is also terrific. The hotel is within easy walking distance of so many sites in the Old City. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a room with a sea view and the beds were comfortable. What a gem of a hotel. october 2010

Reviews.Title: “Convenient very nice hotel in the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn91
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully decorated and clearly well managed. Everything worked well. We had a small twin room without a view but it was very quiet as there was no street noise. Breakfast is on a roof terrace with amazing views. Out one side you see the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia and in the other directions, the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast buffet is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: PamelaAzzi
Reviews.Content: Armada Hotel in the Old City of Istanbul is at a walking distance of all the spots in town. The staff is friendly, smiling and always ready to help you in all what you want; whether it be a place to visit, a destination to go to or simply a room service, trust me it won't take less than a minute... The terrace is superb overlooking the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, the perfect place for a romantic lunch and diner. As for the breakfast i guess it will take a lifetime to forget this copious table and generous variety of food. We're planning a second visit to Istanbul and our choice (my husband and I) is Armada Hotel. Cannot wait :)

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely charming hotel in the most desirable location.”
Reviews.Author: sgoetz53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the hand-painted panels in our room. Another memorable moment was shortly after we arrived. We went to the Terrace Restaurant on the roof of the Armada. The Blue Mosque was illuminated, the Marmara Sea was shining under a crescent moon, and we heard the call to prayer from the minarets. This was a memory we will have the rest of our lives. Incomparable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: TrottaGnam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding for 3 nights in early October. Here's the summary: The good: - location: close to the water, Blue Mosque, hippodrome, cistern and Aya Sophia - nice/helpful lobby (front desk) staff - GREAT roof-top terrace - excellent breakfast (except coffee -- it really sucked! No turkish cofee...) - my room opened up on an elevated garden in the inner courtyard (with fruit trees) -- nice! - free wireless Internet The bad: - no gym (an important thing for me) - smallish rooms - no shampoo (but can be obtained upon request) - very overpriced bar and room service - not very pleasant wait-stuff at breakfast - internet worked very poorly half of the time The ugly: - nothing particularly ugly, except for the extremely polluted air outside; but, that's not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooftop breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lionessStuart_Fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our tour group of 16 in this charming boutique like well located Istanbul hotel, across from the Mara sea and within walking distance to great restaurants and all the major tourist sites. The room, though somewhat small and spartan were very clean. The extravagant, Turkish breakfast each morning was wonderful, enhanced by the ambiance of the setting, on the rooftop open air restaurant. The view was magnificent, with the sea on one side and the Blue Mosque and Haja Sophia on the other side. Definitely a lovely setting and comfortable first class hotel choice for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing time in midst of bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Maki_1973
Reviews.Content: A little bit far from ultanahmet station to the hotel, some up and downs as it is located in old historical place, it is located along seaside. Very calm and warm atmosphere. Room is clean, no bath tub. Breakfast at terrace with perfect view of sea, Sulhanahment camii and Aya-sophia. Very reasonable price at August. I will surely come back to this hotel when next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Taste of Turkey”
Reviews.Author: jmfowler5
Reviews.Content: Charming, comfortable hotel. Rooms were well decorated and cozy. We liked the roof restaurant for the view. The breakfasts were very good as was the dinner we had there. The neighborhood below the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia is developing into an interesting area for shops, restaurants, and small hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting blend of historic and modern.”
Reviews.Author: silvp
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Armada in June. The lobby is beautifully decorated and welcoming - loved the turtle pool! The staff were courteous and efficient. My room was well appointed with a well stocked bathroom - olive oil soap and bathrobes. The bed was comfortable and the linen was luxurious. Complimentary bookmarks and Time Out Istanbul magazine much appreciated. Breakfasts were sumptuous - traditional Turkish food and western food available. The views from the restaurant terrace were breathtaking! There are many tourist sites within walking distance and some excellent if pricey seafood restaurants. Steep narrow streeets may be difficult for some people to negotiate. It was a lovely way to end such a memorable holiday! Turkish hospitality is truly impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JurrienRoossien
Reviews.Content: Without any doubt I classify this hotel as one of the best I have visited the last few years. With a splendid view from the terrace you see and experience the character of Istanbul. Within a few minutes you can walk from the hotel to some major events.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueD03
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for "main" sites and older parts of town .. walk-able plus close by for lots of good restaurants. The kids loved the turtles and I loved the delicious breakfasts with an excellent choice. Saw occasional dolphins from the dining room. Friendly staff. Rooms were a little more interesting than the bland chain hotels. Only complaint..poor value lunch.

Reviews.Title: “It's a special hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasFiona
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a group of 21 older adults, most hypercritical of amenities. This hotel was definitely well run. All public areas and our room were immaculate. The public bathroom was so nice, I made all the women in our group check it out!!!! The staff, except for the evening waiters, were extremely polite and helpful. The waiters at night seemed to pride themselves with their arrogance and irregular service. Not so in the morning at the breakfast buffet or in the bar. We had a drink before dinner and were plied with so much bar food we almost didn't eat dinner. I would stay at this hotel again if I had transportation. it is a bit away from all the tourist sites in this section of the city if you plan on walking. It was a hotel that you left feeling good about having stayed there. You were relaxed and well tended. Wish I could say that about more of the hotels in high tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGirl123
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on numerous good reviews. While the hotel is not bad, it is not as nice as many reviewers have made it out to be. Yes, the hotel is located in Sultanahment, but you to walk up a very steep hill. The 15 minute walk up a hill with no sidewalks (there was also lots of construction in the area) in 100 degree heat made it difficult and unpleasant. Yes, the hotel is located in Sultanahmet, but it does not mean that everything will be at your door step. Sultanahmet are is large. It's also 15-20 walk to the tram stop which made it inconvenient to come back to the hotel in the afternoon if wanted to change before dinner. The room was very small. Once we put our suitcases on the floor, there was no space left to walk. And we paid for a superior room. We asked a king bed but instead got two twins. When we complained, they pushed the two beds together and put an extra matress cover to make the beds stay together. The sea view wasn't that great either. There was a break in between two buldings so you could see a bit of the sea but not what we imagined. It was not worth the extra cash to pay for the sea view. The front desk were not very enthusiastic when I asked questions on several occasions. I asked them about a tour to Gallipoli and they picked the most expensive travel agency which we declined. The hotel does have a very nice roof top but so do many other hotels. You could always come for drinks and stay somewhere else. The breakfast buffet was nice but there was no meat served in the 9 days we were these. I like fresh fruit for breakfast but it would have been nice to have some meat too. You should avoid the hotel restaurant for dinner. The prices are outrageous. If we come back to Istanbul again, we will stay around Istiklal street. Istiklal has much better restaurant selection and the locals are less aggressive. The biggest drawback to staying in Sultanahmet are the agressive locals who are constantly trying to sell you things. It is impossible to walk two steps without some local asking you to buy something and buy it an extremely inflated price. We found the locals in that area quiet unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable home base for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DrSuzi
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and spoke good English. They lent me some Superglue for a broken luggage strap. The beds were very hard, but the second day I noticed in the hotel info that you could get a pillowtop, which helped a lot. Yummy breakfast on the rooftop with nice view of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: mcar328gts
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Armada Hotel in Istanbul very much. The location is great, the hotel and in-house facilities are very nice, the service was excellent and the Terrace restaurant in the hotel was great. The included breakfast buffet was especially memorable, with an amazing array of good things to eat and a setting (on the rooftop) that afforded a tremendous view of the Sultanhamet and the Marmara Sea port. The only negative aspect is the traffic at the hotel can be extremely slow due to the very narrow streets in the immediate area. If you need to travel by cab to/from the airport (or other destinations) you need to allow extra time, especially during the daytime. In most cases, you'd be better off walking a few blocks to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel close to points of intrest”
Reviews.Author: dorak1
Reviews.Content: I remember especially the breakfast buffet... the sweet oriental tastes...mmm, delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all sightseeings & nice view from the terrace!”
Reviews.Author: chriskats
Reviews.Content: Great location,well decorated rooms,great breakfast (perfect quality,big variety). The key point for Armada hotel is that you can get your breakfast or dinner up the terrace of the hotel and having view to Aya Sofia and Sultanahmet Camii (Blue Mosque). Istanbul is one of the most beautiful and interesting places in the world.Is is really worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “kind and friendly”
Reviews.Author: MomocoV
Reviews.Content: we were staying there 3 nights,breakfast is healthy and good food!! the view from hotel' restaurant was amazing!!!! especialy at night. The front desk there is a guy, you can ask him where you should go in Istanbul.(its free) He was so kind navigater!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: anca-yvette
Reviews.Content: I haven't been in the hotel, but I very much enjoyed the fab restaurant, which is one of the most stunning location I ever been in my life. The terrace is overlooking the Gold Horn, the Bosphorous, and the Marmara, you can see the great Mosques..The atmosphere and the decoration is world class. It's just heart stopping stunning. The food was perfect and the services impeccable. If you want a memorable evening never to forget, I suggest eating at this restaurant and enjoying the food and the incredible sightings.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for romantic holiday - great location”
Reviews.Author: thaddeusf
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Armada Hotel in Istanbul was fantastic. It is within easy walking distance to every major old city destination. And for those further out destinations, the hotel staff is extremely helpful in arranging transportation, tours, guides, or anything else that might be needed. The breakfast in the Armada must be mentioned as well. Each morning you have traditional Turkish foods and it is just fantastic. The rooms are rather traditional and modest but are full of quality and very clean. It is a great complement to romantic holidays. We both very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: KathieandAlain
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were excellent. The room was spacious, bright, clean and up-dated. The food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Armada hotel is just lovely -- terrific location -- wonderful rooftop eating!”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrandm0ther
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 delightful nights at the Armada Hotel in Istanbul during April 2010. My room was delightful and very comfortable -- also clean with attentive service. It is very well located -- and has a marvelous glassed over rooftop restaurant (with very good food) and open rooftop terrace, from there one can easily see the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and the Bosphorus with the boat traffic -- the view is especially dramatic after dark. I would stay there again in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Huge stay !”
Reviews.Author: jupassemard
Reviews.Content: Very nive place, well located in the old town (very close to major touristic sites). Very beautiful view on the Blue Mosque and St Sophie from the restaurant ensuring a nice breakfast and a smooth awakening! Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, Awesome Breakfast & Super Clean!”
Reviews.Author: simonepress
Reviews.Content: I love TripAdvisor and I always scan through the reviews of various hotels before I book! For this hotel - I noticed that it had gotten some really amazing reviews yet was also really, really wallet-friendly. (I paid about $100 USD per night back in December which is considered peak travel time for Istanbul.) THIS HOTEL LIVED UP TO THE HYPE EVERY BIT! I have to say - after coming home - I still dream about the breakfasts that were served, I dream about how neat, tidy and clean our room was as well as how lovely the view was on the roof garden! I absolutely LOVED this hotel and hope you'll stay there because it really is one of the best deals and one of the best spots in town to stay! The hotel is centrally located in Sultahnahmet which is a popular area of Istanbul for hotels. You'll notice - if you walk the streets - that there are tons of tour offices, inns, hotels, souvenir shops, cafes, etc in the area and it's really great if you're a tourist. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Hagya Sofya and Blue Mosque. Everyone in these reviews talks about the "uphill" walk but really it's not that bad. There is about one particularly steep hill when you're walking to the sightseeing destinations- but the rest aren't too bad. Once you're near the Hagya Sofya/Blue Mosque there is easy access to the trams, buses, etc. that run throughout the city and allow you to get to various areas. We found the bus system/tram system really easy to figure out and even made it to Asia one afternoon (if you go there try Ciya - the food is amazing)! The hotel rooms are small-ish but definitely not cramped. I mean it's Istanbul not Milwaukee! There is enough space and the bathrooms were both absolutely clean, modern and a good-size with a very good shower. There is also a safe in room along with a heating/AC. We stayed when it was Winter so we kept the heat on - but there is an absolutely lovely window to open as well as AC if you're traveling during other times of year. The lobby is great - complete with a little pool filled with turtles as well as various birds in birdcages. There is a cafe there where they serve coffee as well as an internet room where people can purchase time. The internet cafes are cheaper but if you just want to get onto cheap email it's definitely convenient to have there. There are also several elevators throughout the hotel and when I was there they were all working! The breakfasts are absolutely AMAZING! They are served on the hotel's roofdeck. It's a closed space but there is an open space parallel to it where you can sit outside when it's nice out. The views are spectacular. On one side you see the ocean and on the other side - there's a gorgeous view of the Sofya church as well as the Mosque. Definitely an exciting spot to eat breakfast. As for the food - it's absolutely incredible! The coffee is great, the eggs are delicious and there are tons of other treats like dolmatas (grape leaves), turkish delight, toast, yogurts, toppings and even honeycomb!!! The food was really spectacular as was the view so there is nothing to be missed there! The staff is great -- the guy that we worked with who is the concierge is awesome! Mr. Mazliyah. He's really helpful with bits of info. My brother - who I was staying with and who had been roadtripping in Europe - needed a laundry spot. So he gave us great directions and was super helpful in suggesting ways for us to get to Asia for the day. He was super helpful. There is also a restaurant on the top floor of the hotel (where bfast is served) and it serves delicious, modern Turkish cuisine. This hotel allowed me an amazing stay! The rooms were great - clean, comfy and modern; the food was delicious and the location was prime. It's a great place to stay and I'd absolutely suggest it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LisaG2010
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is located at the bottom of the hill for most popular site seeing destinations in the city the walk was short to the Blue Mosque and very close to the metro station for other destinations. The rooms were clean and quiet and the food was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Skepparen
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent breakfast and kitchen, expensive wines (like everywhere in Istanbul), clean and neat room. Just a couple of hundred meters from train station, taxis available, close to restaurant streets and mosquees.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint and comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lnasih
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel with clean, cute, and cozy rooms. Breakfast was great, both in terms of the food and setting...Location of the hotel was great as well, as it was in a quiet area (away from the hustle and bustle of the city) yet just a few minutes away (~ 10-15 minute walk) from Sultanahmet (i.e. Hagia sofia etc...) where you can catch the tram to different parts of the city. A train is also available very close by that goes to different parts of the city. Staff were friendly and helpful...would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AN ideal location for visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: yvonnecumbria
Reviews.Content: The Armada is well situated for visiting the main sights in Istanbul. Our room was very comfortable, the staff were friendly and welcoming, the meals were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Armada, the prefect place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Willem60
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a few nights in hotel Armada, due to a UNESCO conference for which i was invited. It was not my first time in the wonderful city of Istanbul, but the hotel transcended my expectations: decent, clean and spacy rooms, well equiped for wireless internet; wonderful Turkish breakfast on the top floor with a wonderful view on the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus, and last but not least a gentle and very customer friendly service. This hotel is not only excellent for middle size conferences, but I am about to book a room for a long leisure weekend as well!

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly suitable”
Reviews.Author: musfik
Reviews.Content: I was in istanbul for a competition . Stayed there for one night. Location is wonderful. Although it is at the hearth of old istanbul it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We liked staying at Armada”
Reviews.Author: warrenMunich
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet in the morning with all the varieties Turkey can offer, was an an absolut treat with a fantastique view over the Bosporus. The hotel is very clean, we liked the Olive soap in the bathroom very much. We discovered the railway only 2 minutes away after a few days that takes you direct to the centre and that was very practical.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: yaleavenue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Armada for a week of vacation. Extraordinary breakfast buffet, superlative housekeeping and extremely attentive staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Location cannot be surpassed. Very comfortable and nicely appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, thoroughly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ma9549
Reviews.Content: Staff at hotel were incredibly friendly, we needed the mattress changing when we first arrived, which they did immediately. They dealt with all our queries in a friendly manner. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Sultanahmet mosque and Ayia Sophia. It can be a bit tricky to find the way as you have to go down some back alleys, but once you have figured it out, it's not an issue. The hotel is fairly large, reception area is really intersting - turtles in a pond, cute little birds, and lovely pictures, I particularly liked the Ottoman Caligraphy around the walls. One outstanding thing about the hotel was it's breakfast, in a word STUNNING. 10 metre long table full of food!! Something to suit everyone's taste including local foods and the usual continental breakfast type food. Made the hotel really good value as we would only eat out once a day after fuelling up in the morning. There is also a roof terrace with views of the Bosphorus and Sultanahmet Mosque. This would be great in the Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't change anything”
Reviews.Author: FredFromSpace
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, lovely stay what else to say. Please just don't change anything!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Policy53
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms have decent views, but not worth the premium charged. Location is not convenient to the historic sites. No easy access to the tram or boat launches, meaning you spend a lot on taxis. The concierge service is good but they go for the expensive restaurants. The reception staff including manager is rude and unhelpful. the view from the terrace is great, but one can go for a drink at night versus staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay & feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: Raghodi
Reviews.Content: - Neat & clean - Feels like home - Located near many historical places (walkable) - Food is excellent - Quite & calm

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 19Atlanta91
Reviews.Content: Close enough to easily walk to historic sites, far enough away to not be in the middle of all the hub-bub ..... a great little find of a hotel. The restaurant has fabulous views and the food was excellent - great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice hotel with good location and clean rooms, especially good food.”
Reviews.Author: ardenchang
Reviews.Content: Ask the service staff about your trip tips in Istanbul. Sit by the window during the breakfast that you could have a very cool seaview.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous views, breakfast, and staff”
Reviews.Author: NewWorldtraveller_9
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit sceptical about the good reviews about the wonderful views and location but they were well deserved. The breakfast served on the covered terrace is terrific and the views of the sea on one side and the blue mosque on the other are spectacular. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The staff was helpful without being annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be.”
Reviews.Author: pepperkennedy
Reviews.Content: I chose the Armada on the basis of excellent Tripadvisor reviews and while not disappointed by the general cleanliness, location and facilities, was not overwhelmed by service or attitude. I found the staff less than friendly - on checking in we were offered a twin bedded room, having specifically asked for a double. Only by insisting were we given a double, but this was a smoking room and was not entirely pleasant to be in. Nor did it seem like the "superior" room that we had paid for. It was adequate, but not exactly four star. On the plus side, it's on a quiet street, the views of the Blue Mosque and the sea are very lovely, and the menagerie of turtles and song birds in the lobby are quite charming!.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, accommodating and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tvinci1
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, accommodating and convenient. Great for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely traditional Turkish hotel, perfectly positioned for walking to all the ancient sites.”
Reviews.Author: JerryB_Luton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for visiting (walking) the ancient mosques, palaces and other sites. The hotel is adjacent to the Bosphorous sea, and reserving a room over-looking the sea is recommended. The hotel is traditional, and provides an excellent and much varied choice of breakfast. The service is excellent and the rooms are cleaned and all linen is changed daily. in the

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect -- Best Hotel of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: gauchocat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Armada for two nights in Nov, 2009. We arrived at about 10am, obviously too early to check in, but the Armada had our room ready in about five minutes. As we had been on the overnight train from Thessaloniki (not comfortable, NOT the Orient Express of yesteryear), getting us straight to our room was much appreciated. Our room looked over the old city wall towards the waterway, providing beautiful maritime views. The room was spotless. Although so many people smoke in this part of the world, the hotel had the good sense to segregate the non-smoking rooms in one area, and it seemed as though the HVAC system also had a filter. Moreover, when we went to breakfast in the morning, we saw that the housekeeping staff is equipped with HEPA filters they carry around and set in the hallway when they are cleaning rooms. This was an amazing effort, unseen in the other hotels on our trip. BTW, the housekeepers wore hospital scrubs, which was fitting given how clean they kept everything. The breakfast buffet was great -- every kind of local and regional food, from the regular (fresh farm cheeses and dried fruits) to the exotic (chunks of fresh honeycomb). We also had dinner in the restaurant -- the food was first class, the service was excellent, and the wine list featured Turkish (Anatolian) wines, organized and described in a clear manner. For a first class restaurant, the price was totally fair. The location is excellent -- just far enough from the Sultanhamet sites to keep you out of the tourist zone, but close enough to walk right out to them (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, etc.), even when it was raining. The only ding was that on Friday night there was a wedding in one of the many conference rooms, and so the booming music reverberated throughout the hotel. We telephoned the desk (as we had an early flight in the morning) and were informed the music would continue until at least midnight. This seemed a little late given the impact on the rest of the hotel, but the music actually died out a little earlier. In short, we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel, and at about 110 euros per night, including breakfast, found it to be an A++ value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Armada Hotel: a gem in the city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jwtheen
Reviews.Content: I really wish we could have taken advantage of the hospitality for more time. The rooms were great, the bed was very comfortable and the rooftop restaurant defies description. Sitting on the terrace with a glass of wine, the yogurt kebab (one of the best dishes anywhere!), and our friends while gazing at the Blue Mosque in one direction and the Bosporus/Golden Horn/ Sea of Marmara in the other direction produced a magical evening. We unfortunately had an airport connection at 3 AM but the attentive staff produced a wonderful breakfast of bread, cheese, olives, dried fruit and coffee for our early departure. We will return! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JDougl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Armada for 5 days and would recommend it as an excellent place to discover this city. The hotel is downhill from the main tourist attractions and is very close to the coast. The breakfast buffet has an excellent array on offer, including fresh pastries and bread that are delivered from a bakery down the street; and also jams and preserves that the hotel produce themselves (look out for the jars of cherries fermenting on the terrace). Sadly the dinner leaves a little to be desired, as it is something of a cliche menu. One highlight was that we told our waiter how much we enjoyed his Turkish coffee and the next day he had went to the spice market and picked some up for us! Try and get a room with a view of the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Overall I would recommend the Armada as one of the best hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous”
Reviews.Author: boccalone
Reviews.Content: service very good and excellent room. the location is fantastic in the hearth of the historical peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, excellent location, elegant style.”
Reviews.Author: rotaNW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, close to major attractions, sheets and bathrooms very clean, decorated in an elegant style, it has a wonderful view from the terrace and breakfast is plenty and interesting. Standard rooms are moderately sized, but not uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Armada has the most amazing views from the terrace.”
Reviews.Author: BarbSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay in Istanbul very much and the Armada Hotel did not let us down. Our room was lovely, very clean and well equipped with the little extras like cotton dressing gowns, slippers and a well stocked fridge! The buffet breakfast each morning was something we looked forward to. It was just out of this world, so much choice with different foods added each day, just wonderful. We ate in the Terrace Restaurant on two occasions and ordered the meze, delicious. The views from the open terrace, especially at night were breathtaking. We certainly would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a marvellous location”
Reviews.Author: CymraegTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Armada was recommended to us and we had stayed twice both for 2 days at either end of a trip to Turunc. The location is in Sultan Ahmet the old town of Istanbul, ideally placed for the Blue Mosque, Hagii Sofia, Cisterns, Grand and Spice Bazaars. The restaurant has views over the Bosphorous on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. We stayed in rooms 229 and 235 both were extremely well appointed and while there were views of the Bosphorous from both room 235 was best. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive and we would thoroughly recommend the Armada. Some words of caution. We arrived in Sabina airport which is a fair way out of Istanbul and the traffic is manic. We took the Havas bus in which dropped us at Taskin the terminus. From there we took a taxi and the driver well and truly ripped us off.

Reviews.Title: “atmoshere, location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: GIANNISGR
Reviews.Content: Excelent atmospheric hotel in a very good location near to Ayasofia and all the other nuseums. Nice restaurant in terrace. The view from there is wonderful. All the places of the hotel, reception, etc and of cource the rooms are excelent. The only suggestion is to have more variaty in breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A warm and kind of intimate place guarded by efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Trifucho
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I felt at home in the Armada since the very begining of our stay. Everything works perfectly, but the essence of achievement would not be enough if the attention of everyone there wouldnâ€™t have been so kind and cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in a a fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Julian_Visby
Reviews.Content: Armada hotel is located at the probably best position in Istanbul. The history peninsula is exactly the place one wants to stay at. Not central while central is probably a good definition of the location. 5 minutes from Hagia Sofia, from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace , Armada Hotel is a place to remember. Beautiful rooms and general environment, great restaurant and a roof terrace with an amazing view toward the Bosporus on one side and the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque on the other one. A great service is not an exception while it feels great. Clean rooms and friendly people taking care of the visitor are great attributes of the marvelous place. Hardly wait untill next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Turkish”
Reviews.Author: Whittlesford
Reviews.Content: Situated just inside the Byzantine sea wall, the Armada is nicely placed for sightseeing in Istanbul. The rooms are comfortable and modern with pleasant Turkish touches, so you know you are in Turkey. Excellent staff at reception. The rooftop restaurant and terrace give a magnificent panorama of the Blue mosque and historic sights as well as of fishing boats and cargo vessels making their way through the Bosphorus. The array of Turkish delicacies at the buffet breakfast is almost worth the trip in itself. There are only two drawbacks: 1. being woken up very early by the calls to prayer form the various mosques but you get used to it after a while and you'd probably get it anywhere in Istanbul. You could close the double-glazed windows, too - and there is air conditioning. 2. the rooms at the back are quite close to the railway. Maybe only a problem for the ultra-sensitive because there aren't many (electric) trains and it didn't bother us - and we hate noisy hotels - but worth mentioning just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value at the Admiral”
Reviews.Author: TATraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality, 4 star hotel in a really good location for getting quickly and easily to the main sights. Its is just a couple of streets down from a 'boutique' area with lots of restaurants - we managed to find a couple of neighborhood, non touristy places which were excellent value and a bit different. The breakfast is a feast - taken on the top floor of the hotel where you can sit with ocean views one way and the blue mosque and hagia sophia the other way . We had a room at the back which was exceptionally quiet - suspect those on the front catch some traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “The choice of the Armada Hotel in Istanbul was one of the better decisions we have made.”
Reviews.Author: larrygberg
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Istanbul included a week's stay at the Armada Hotel. We have traveled a great deal, all over the world, and the Armada was the best reasonably priced hotel we have found in any country. The facilities were clean and comfortable and the location was perfect for our vacation touring. But, the best part was the hotel personnel. They were wonderfully cooperative and helpful, with making adjustments in our arrangements, in finding places to eat wonderful food, in finding our way around, arranging transportation and generally enhancing our visit. Altogether, a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with not super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMoscow
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great! Maybe it's a little too expensive, I think 80-100 euro is the correct price for it. Location is great corresponding to the seaside but with one not too pleasant piece of a shortcut to Sultanahmet area - you need to go under the train railway and some delapodated court yards with no people around but it is only for 50-100 meters. The receptionist did earlier check in for me which I appreciated a lot after a long trip. The room was well equipped. It's clean, maybe a little small but that's absolutely fine for the hotel. Herbal soap was great. Linen is clean. Safe. Everything is wonderful in terms of the equipment and conditions. I was not completely happy there though due to the fact that not all of the staff was friendly. The receptionists were performing their duties with high quality but with minimum emotions and care towards the visitor. I also got a feeling that there are double standards in treating visitors from Western and Eastern Europe witha certain intimidation of the latter rones. The terrace restaurant table order didn't work for me because the waiter intentionally kept offering me the table with poor view although I don't see any other reason why else you would want to come up there for dinner in not so cheap restaurant of the above avarage price hotel??? Eventually I decided to check other options in the city and no one was trying to keep me by offering other compromise options. By the way, there were were three 5 tables with the better view and none of them was offered to me explaining that all of those are reserved. Why then I was making my reservation two days before?

Reviews.Title: “A clean and quiet hotel in the Sultanhamet district”
Reviews.Author: CanadianExBrit
Reviews.Content: A clean and quiet 4 storey hotel close to the seashore and only 15 minutes by foot from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi palace. Room of good size, bed(s) comfortable, bathroom well- maintained, extensive buffet breakfast in rooftop/terrace restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, Sophisticated, Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: WItravelerMadison
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip. We stayed at the Armada in 2007 and in 2009 we were delighted to find everything just as we remembered. Hotel decoration is charming and carefully conceived. The rooms are large, with ample storage and the wainscoting and cupboards are hand painted in the Edirne style. Bedding is crisp and white, with down comforters or cotton coverlets. We appreciated the absence of fake "Ottoman palace" gold and brocades--especially in the summer. Even the hallways are decorated with antiques. The breakfasts on the hotel's rooftop terraces were to die for--lavish spreads which always included traditional Turkish hot and cold dishes, fruits and vegetables, cheeses, Turkish jams and preserves, and several kind of breads, coffees and teas. The view of the Marmora Sea at breakfast (or dinnerâ€“thereâ€™s very good restaurant) was mesmerizing. The only drawback to the Armada--perhaps for travelers with mobility problems--is that it's a short but uphill walk to the heart of Sultanahmet. The staff were charming and always helpful. We've recommended the Armada to all our friends going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: alfaro58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location near The Blue Mospue and Hagia Sophia. It is also within walking distance to a train station and Tram to get to other places around Istanbul. We loved the recommendations for restaurants around the hotel. Each of the them were great! The staff was aldo very good at scheduling tours and shows for us. The terrace restaurant was also very good for breakfast (included) and dinner. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Armada has a great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: TherPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Istanbul and will fondly remember my first stay in Istanbul because of the Armada Hotel. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The breakfast bounty was diverse and tasty. I would choose this hotel again for a future stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Atajack
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in Sept and our stay was spoilt by very poor and unfriendly service something we have never encountered previously on other trips to Turkey. We had a late arrival the first night and booked a table in the Teras only to discover the staff were clearing up after a function and grudgingly served us. Paper rubbish was strewn over the floor which none of the staff thought to remove and when we placed our order for the special "degustation" menu the head waiter who served us couldn't have been more rude and off-hand if he had tried. The final insult was when the bill arrived he pointed to the note about service charge being excluded and said "service extra". Needless to say we did not leave a tip! On another evening we decided to have coffee in the lounge bar. We were the only guests so we asked for the wide screen TV to be turned off. The response from the barman was "not possible, football." When he then turned the volume up we got the message and left without finishing our coffee. The buffet breakfast was in the covered terrace restaurant but again the service was disappointing. Most tables weren't cleared or set up and none of the staff made any effort to greet you or show you a table. Orange or lemon squash were substituted for fruit juice unless one paid an extra 5 Turkish Lira for a glass of fresh orange! What is such a shame is that the hotel is a great location in the historic part of Istanbul with very comfortable rooms. It could be so much better if the effort was made to provide a decent standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay when visiting Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Maville
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet and very good service. Rooms are not large but nicely decorated with painted Turkish designs and very nice wooden floors. Bathroom fairly large and recently renovated. Very functional with nice new showers (no bath), new plumbing and glass washroom door. HD flat screen TV, safe in room, small sofa, chair and desk. The hotel is inside the old city wall of Istanbul and within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, the Bazaar, St-Sophie and a multitude of restaurants and historical sites. From the restaurant and patio which are located on the top floor, we have a grand view of the Blue Mosque, the Asian side of Istanbul, the Bosphore. Very impressive view. For breakfast the buffet includes mostly Turkish food that we North Americans are not used to but there were lots of choices and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel beautifully located, staff was friendly and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: mmorelli47
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious with a very modern bathroom. The room faced the sea, at our request, and there are rooms which face the beautiful Hagia Sophia as well. The buffet breakfast was comprehensive and served on the covered rooftop with views to both city and sea. It was a bit of a walk, though doable, to the major sights, but this allowed for more quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel and experience for two star prices. What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: Vansland
Reviews.Content: From the reviews, we expected a nice hotel but we were blown away in every respect. LOCATION -Prefect. 100 yards to a bench overlooking the Bosphorus & a 10 minute walk up the hill to the Blue Mosque & Hagi Sophia. ROOM - Large, well appointed and decorated ,and very clean. STAFF - Very helpful, spoke English and arranged a 6am breakfast for us prior to our flight back to the US. RESTAURANT- A 5 star expeience. Located on the top floor with a view of the Bosphorus on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. It was expensive but the food and view made it worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - poor service”
Reviews.Author: lfokken
Reviews.Content: We picked the Armada Hotel specifically for it's beautiful terrace restaurant overlooking the Straight and Marmara Sea for our 20th Wedding Anniversary dinner. Unfortunately the restaurant was completely booked for Ramazon. There were numerous posters stating that we needed a reservation but that was not even available. We were redirected to a sister restaurant located on the other side of the city walls and next to the Kennedy Cad. Very good food, but spiked with car fumes. We also had an issue with our airport transfer the following morning, even after an online request and double checking with the clerk the night before. When we went down to the desk the following morning, they had no idea what we were talking about and got someone to reluctantly drive us to the airport. Beautiful spacious lobby, lovely view from our room, but not worth the $200 per night and 40 euro transfer fee.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice of hotel......”
Reviews.Author: RPDSPD
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Istanbul several times in many good hotels, but we were impressed with the Armada Hotel. We booked this hotel on-line for one night at the start of our recent trip, well in advance and paid only Â£63 for a night's accommodation. Fortunately our slight concerns about the location were unfounded and it was fine. We agree with the last review and we indeed took strolls by the sea. We also made use of the railway station that was very close - Cankurtaran - which enabled us to get to Eminonu with our luggage, in order to get the ferry to Hydrapasa station for the vast sum of 1:5 TL! The staff at the hotel were charming and breakfast had lots of choice as a result of our first experience we booked a further night directly with the hotel for our last night in Istanbul - this turned out to be more expensive, but we still felt it was good value at Â£ 90. From experience, we will use the hotel again but we'll ask for a room on the second floor as the view of the Bosphorus is better!

Reviews.Title: “A convenient location with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: DocCharlie
Reviews.Content: The Armada is an excellent place to stay when visiting Istanbul. It is close to the sea but with easy access to the sites of the old section of Istanbul. The roof top breakfast is fantastic. The food is good and the view is great. You see the Blue Mosque, the Ayasofya and the sea from your table. We enjoyed walking along the sea in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Armada Old City, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: tsilva
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel is located near the main attractions in Istanbul. It is a quiet hotel with very helpful personal. We stayed for two nights and it was just a 500m walk to Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. From the hotel terrace, which is used as the hotel restaurant it has a great view over the Blue Mosque. A dinner there is quite a unremarkable experience. The breakfast was not that good, as they only had bread, cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Spike75
Reviews.Content: Advised by friends, I picked up this hotel and I was not disappointed. Very well located within the old city, Armada Hotel is a cosy and quiet place with a very attractive price considering the quality of services. A very good starting point to discover Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Culture-tripper
Reviews.Content: The best city hotel we had in 25 years ! Paris, Londen , Amsterdam and Brussels hotels can learn somethng about service from the ARMADA HOTEL in Istanbul. Room was excellent, great kingsize bed. Very enjoyable airco, which does not freeze you ! Safe, minibar included. The personel gave us super support in english from the moment of arrival to departure. Breakfast and dinner on the roof, which sight on Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque and sea of marmara are a GREAT EXPERIENCE. Small remark on the breakfast: some continental bread should be offered ( such as croissants and brown bread ). For the rest we can only be positive. We will certainly repead this city trip to Istanbul thanks to ARMADA HOTEL !!!

Reviews.Title: “Dining on the Armada's rooftop was a highlight of our Istanbul trip”
Reviews.Author: MargieAlexandriaVA
Reviews.Content: I searched long and hard to find the right hotel in Istanbul's historic Sultanahmet area, and I made the perfect choice. I was traveling with a group of 8 so the pressure was on me. The Armada's staff was friendly, attentive,and helpful, the rooms were spacious (mine had a lovely view of the Sea of Marmara), and the hotel's location was convenient.. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous, and I can say honestly that the rooftop dinner we had at the Armada was the best meal we had in Istanbul, and the view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia was unbeatable. It was a 10-15 minute walk uphill to the sites, but we enjoyed the fascinating streets on the way. Faye USA

Reviews.Title: “Cool and inviting Ottoman haven”
Reviews.Author: elanjane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally placed in the old town close to the Mamara Sea down a small cobbled street. The hotel is not impressive from the outside but is cool inside and full of interesting artefacts in the lobby and painted and decorated in Ottoman style, The staff are friendly and helpful. The superior rooms have a view of the Blue Mosque, St Sophia or the sea, but the view is not spectacular as there are a lot of decrepit buildings in the way. Perhaps this adds to the charm and contrasts with the fairytale minarets of the nearby mosques. The most stunning aspect is the wonderful terrace on top of the hotel with fabulous views of Istanbul. The food is amazing in the award winning restaurant and the mezes are delicious. It is lovely to eat there in the evening with the lights and sunset. Don`t forget to sample the homemade cherry liquor after dinner. The breakfast is amazing with fruits, nuts, raisins, cereals, yoghurt plus egg dishes, homemade breads and pastries. It is placed just a few minutes from the main attractions and just up the hill on the way are many carpet shops, better priced than in the Grand Bazaar and lovely little cafes which are all reasonably priced. loving it so much will definitely be coming back. The only reason I have not given this hotel full marks is that there is no pool. A rooftop one would have been perfection.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: galinav
Reviews.Content: It's a decent hotel. What we liked: 1) clean and friendly 2) they let us check out at 3pm 3) not very expensive What we did not like: 1) Breakfast seems variable, but all the ingredients are of very poor quality 2) Actually, it's a pretty long walk to the center of Sultanamet (all up a very steep heel); there were lots of other hotels on the way, I walked into one to inquire about the price, it was the same as Armada - but in a nicer area, in the midst of restaurants. So if you can afford to walk in the are before you bring your things to the hotel - do it, you will definitely find a better and cheaper place that is not advertised on expedia 3) Beaware of the dinner at the rooftop restaurant: it's not so good and extremely overpriced! General advice: we figured that it's actually better not to stay in the Old Town, next time we will book a place around Taksim (Galata Tower area): the Old Town is too touristy, too expensive, the sellers are too annoying, while Taksim is uncomparably better in all these respects, and is well connected to the Old town (plus, cabs are very cheap in Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location--helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dhappel54
Reviews.Content: The Armada was our base of operations for a week in Istanbul. The location is perfect--easy access to all the major Sultanhamet attractions, main roads and mass transit, with views of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque most prominent. The rooms are smallish but tastefully done and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is large and varied and the terrace is a beautiful place to dine. The staff are very accomodating. The only two issues: The showers are poorly designed and flood the bathroom. The staff restaurant recommendations tend towards overpriced tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Parisian_13
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at the Armada Hotel. We had a room are a little bit small but nice with a see view. Retaurant and breakfast place are amazing with a view on Saint Sophia on one side and the Bosphorus on the other. The only problem with the hotel is the location. It's very close to the Bosphorus at the bottom of the Hill so it's a little bit far on foot from tram station and the main visiting place. When you come back after a good day of visit you are a little bit leasy to leave again for dining. But the restaurant is very good so...

Reviews.Title: “Fine Little Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DJK49
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this property to attend a conference. While the breakfast was fine and varied, it seemed a little bit less extensive than during my previous stay two years ago. The roof-top seating for the restaurant is terrific and offers a great view. On the downside the aggressive gulls steal food and make a nuisance of themselves. Staff is professional, rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated but nothing special. Wireless Internet was fast. My thumbdrive picked up a virus from a computer in the business center. An admirable hotel. In its district it looks like there are many other intriguing properties.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Close”
Reviews.Author: Historynan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a delight. Rooms are spacious, with a sofa by the window and a little desk for working. WiFi is free and fast. The staff was very helpful with a variety of requests. A delicious buffet breakfast is served in a spacious room overlooking the Marmara Sea.. The location is ideal for visiting the Sultanahmet area of the city, but is far enough away from the noisy main streets to be quiet. From my room I had a view of the Blue Mosque. I can hardly wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Turkish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Searcher5
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Armada Hotel in Istanbul. Our room was very comfortable, clean and stylish. It had a feeling of being Turkish rather than an American or western European chain. We loved the view from our room of the Sea of Marmara - it is one of my memories of our trip. We also found the restaurant to be excellent. The quality of the food was a wonderful surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Pastmaster
Reviews.Content: Approach through a gate in the old city walls. Doesn`t look much from outside. Spacious, cool, rececption area with ottoman era pictures, artifacts etc. Terrace restaurant is best feature with views over Sea of Marmara and to the rear the domes and minarets of Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. Within walking distance of Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, indeed we walked all the way over to Galata Bridge, Spice Market and Eminonu (where ferry boats leave). We had a sea view room, air con worked - the only problem was the swipe card door entry system which never worked first time (didn`t hear of any other guests having this problem). I visit Istanbul 3 or 4 times a year on business so know the city well (both European and Asian sides) and can recommend this hotel for a holiday / cultural / sightseeing visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Batutta
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. The hotel has a pleasant rooftop restaurant with fine views of the Bosporus, Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very friendly hotel ideal for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CorionConsett
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife daughter and partner have just returned and we cannot rate this hotel highly enough, it is spotlessly clean and other than a walk up quite steep hill to the main square, it is in the perfect location for the best sightseeing. It has a fantastic roof terrace for breakfast, dinner and drinks. I had my wallet stolen on the tramway but the guest relations manger Ufuk Serab took me to the police station, acted as interpreter and helped me through the whole process, all it cost was one beer in the bar afterwards! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Instanbul for pleasure. As for Istanbul itself the old city is great, good food, friendly people, plenty to see and do, but Taksim is worth a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Armada Hotel ist a good package in a good level of quality.”
Reviews.Author: VF38
Reviews.Content: The room ist OK, The lobby bar OK, Breakfast and terrasse very good. Personnal very kind and good service. It would be better with a welness room , with sauna and spa?...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but can be noisey and rooms are small unless you upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Bahrainboy
Reviews.Content: So whilst Armada scores well for location and is very clean with friendly staff, we ended up not being able to sleep on two nights. The first was not the fault of the hotel as there was a street party. The second was their fault and little was done to make things better. They seem to hold functions and the noise from these goes through the hotel. Also, the standard rooms are small and so we ended up upgrading (we had our 2 year old with us). The upgraded room was beautifully furnished. The beds however are hard (though they provided us with a softening pad) The location- whilst fantastic for adults- is not good with children as there are no pavements and cobbled roads and so pushcair use was really difficult. Great buffet breakfast- no meat but lots of really fresh local delicacies (like fresh butter, honey, cheese, bread etc) So overall a good place which is clean and more than just functional (ie more charm than an IBIS) but with good enough standards that you dont always find from non-chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and views of Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia”
Reviews.Author: chuckinNaples
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel has a great location and is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and even the Grand Bazaar if you are a good walker. Rooms have excellent views of Blue Mosque /Hagia Sophia and the hotel terrace/breakfast room has even better views for taking excellent photos. They serve an excellent buffet breakfast with good variety of dried cereals, fresh baked bred\ads, rolls, nuts, fruits, omelets, and real fresh honey. Our room was clean. The only negative thing about the room was the stupid shower design. Water from the shower runs down a glass wall (that separates the toilet from the shower area) that stops 1 inch from the floor, thus the water drains onto the main bathroom floor and everywhere else in the bathroom. You need several bath mats to soak up the floor. Their computer is free to check your email, which is a nice service. Despite the poor shower design, I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Armada Hotel is perfect place to discover Istanbuls Old City”
Reviews.Author: Susanne2807
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the old city of Istanbul and close to the main attractions (e.g. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Saray, etc.). I.e. you can reach it easily by a short walk. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are cleaned every day. The restaurant/terrasse of Armada provides are impressive view on Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia as well as to the Bosporus&Marmara Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay in a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenivtsa
Reviews.Content: The Armada is a great place to stay. It's a very short (although uphill) walk to many of the tourist attractions and public transportation. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated, and it has a fabulous rooftop terrace with views of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. The breakfasts are amazing (I could have eaten breakfast for every meal!), and the staff are very kind and helpful with any request you might have... a softer mattress, extra shampoo, directions to a Catholic Church on Easter, etc. And, there's free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Istanbul itself is a wonderful city to visit, and staying at the Armada made it an even better, more relaxing trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “a friendly and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: giorlandone
Reviews.Content: armada is a nice and well-managed hotel, with spotless clean rooms, environmentally friendly attitude and excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with real Turkish style”
Reviews.Author: jslavin
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located Easy walk near Topkapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, the hotel has a lovely feel that does not leave you feeling as though you could be anywhere. Rooftop breakfast room has great views and excellent selection. Staff was warm, friendly and on top of any question. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I love Estambul forever...”
Reviews.Author: elmacana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia, at five minutes walking. The breakfasts were spectacular, with all kinds of local food and the terrace and the dining room have incredible views. The personal attention was great. I forgot one item in the hotel and they sent me it to Spain with no charge. Magnificent and totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: gclylmz
Reviews.Content: We had spent five days at Armada including new yearâ€™s eve. The whole vacation was very nice but the fun that we had on new yearâ€™s eve party which was arranged by the hotel was the best part of our trip. Service, music, food, fireworks, staff and the gifts given in the beginning of the night made the night even better. The rest of our vacation was as perfect as that night also. The location of the hotel lets the guests see the main historical places easily. The rooms are very comfortable. The breakfast at the terrace where has a unique view of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus was delicious. I strongly recommend this hotel to the people who make plans for an Ä°stanbul visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filippos21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our stay at the hotel. Besides the excellent room condition and view, hotel stuff was very kind. We recommend the lovely breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgious views”
Reviews.Author: Voyageuse09
Reviews.Content: I love this Hotel and recommend it . The rooms are simple and lovely. Free Wi Fi internet access in the all Hotel, an excellent buffet breakfast, a delicious restaurant, a wonderfull view on the Bosphorus and Marmara See as well as on the Sainte Sophie and Blue Mosques. A marvellous and romantic terrasse on the room. The staff is very nice. I go to this hotel 3 times a year and I am never desappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view and the service”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsSam
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel was a very good experience for me. I have seldom stayed at a hotel with such an excellent service and with such friendliness towards the customers. The hotel is situated nearly perfect within a 10 minute walk from all major attractions in Istanbul, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the Grand Bazar. The view from the restaurant on the top floor was amazing, the Bosphorus in one direction and the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque in the other. The food was also excellent. On top of it all, the price was very modest. My stay in December was a business trip, but I intend to go back already the first week of January on a private trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tyroneiii
Reviews.Content: The Armada is a wonderful value for the money. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. After the first night I noted that one of flyers in the room said that a softer mattress would be provided if the one supplied was too hard. Although I like hard mattresses I thought the one on the bed was a little too spartan and the mattress was replaced at my request. The breakfast buffet (included in the price of the room) was a great value. The dining area is on top of the hotel providing great views of Santa Sophia and the Blue Mosque. My one problem with the hotel is its location. It is not handy to public transportation and about the only way to get around is by tax. To be truthful the hotel is at the bottom of a very steep hill on top of which are the aforesaid Santa Sophia and Blue Mosque. But since I do not have mountain goat genes I found climbing the hill and even descending was too much of a chore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PowertripUk
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit to Turkey on business and also the second stay at the Armada Hotel. On both occasions I experienced most friendly staff who have a good understanding of English. The room was very clean and well decorated. The general surroundings inside the hotel are very pleasant and there are several interesting features in the foyer including a fountain,complete with a family of turtles! The only slight downside was that the wi-fi coverage was not great and only worked in certain areas of the room. Colleagues who were also staying at the hotel found similar problems. That said, it was always possible to get connectivity, so no great problem there. The breakfast buffet, served in the terrace restaurant was exceptional with a huge selecton of cheese, fruit and savory dishes to choose from, with the added advantage of stunning views from the windows. I would definitely stay ther again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “A great place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: glassguy213
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a wonderful city and the Armada is very close to the historic sites. It is a quite nice hotel near the water and near the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, and walkable to the Grand Bazaar. It is not like a fancy 5 star luxury place, but more like a nice country inn. Hard to describe, but very comfortable, clean, and quiet. My only complain is that the restaurant was not completely non-smoking and it was smoky in there. Too bad because the food was very good. Nice spread at breakfast and good food for dinner. I was suprised by how nice Istanbul was and this hotel was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back to Armada Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lobeli
Reviews.Content: We were very, very happy with our stay at Armada Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is situated between The Blue Mosque and The Marmara Sea, so the view from the roof terrass was breath-taking.. It was also very convieniant with Hagia Sofia, Topkapi, The Basilika Cistern and hamambath within walking distance. The hotel is spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not big, but we spent our time exploring the city, so it didn't matter to us. The beds were big but a bit too hard for our taste. The breakfast buffe gives you a good start with fresh, delicious and interesting Turkish food in rich variaty. The restaurant is on the top floor, so - again - the view adds something extra to your meal, which in itself was most enjoyable. The waiters are attentive and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, really enjoyed our stay at Armada”
Reviews.Author: Stefsailinturkey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Armada offers a great service and the staff are exceptional both in service and hospitality. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and would not consider staying anywhere else. With close proximity to Blue Mosque and overlooking the Bospheros, breakfast on the terrace provides the most amazing views. The rooms were spacious and offered everything that you need. We will definity be recommending this hotel to our clients who charter with Sail in Turkey and we will be returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: atheniantraveller
