Reviews.Content: Hotel Armada offers very good value for money, high quality breakfast, free wifi, clean and well equiped rooms. Its location is ideal -a 10 minute walk to Aghia Sophia, a 15 minute ride to Taksim Square- and the view from the terrace where breakfast is served is unique The staff is extremely friendly and polite (which is mostly the case in Turkey). I will definetely stay there again. Just a minor tip: the way up to Aghia Sophia and the Sultanahmet Square might be somewhat difficult for the physically challenged or for older people. In this case a taxi will definetely be needed (shouldn't cost more than YTL 3.5).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Armada in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MrKovacis
Reviews.Content: Between Oct 28 - Nov 2-2008 we - seven friends travelling together - spent the most fantastic days in Istanbul. We had booked the trip ourselves and was recommended to stay at hotel Armada. Our expectations were high and they were fulfilled on every point from the Armada hotel. Rooms excellent, breakfast extraordinary and the friendly atmosphere made a solid ground for our first visit in the big city. The staff at hotel Armada really made the visit easier to us - they were helpful with information, bookings of tickets and restaruants and general hints on "how to get around". The overall impression of hotel Armada is a friendly hotel with high standards and excellent service - a perfect place to stay in the busy city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Armada”
Reviews.Author: hjhater
Reviews.Content: Very nice quaint hotel. Location is very good to see most of the sites in Istanbul. Staff was generally friendly & helpfull. Very, Very nice restaurant on the top. Rooms were very clean. My only complaint would be the gardner. He started working in the garden at 5:30 one morning right outside my window. Woke us up.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed fully Armada Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geogeo_43
Reviews.Content: We fully enjoyed our stay at Armada Hotel in Istanbul . The hotel is very well situated near the Aghia Sophia Museum ,the Topkapi Palace and the SultanAhmet Blue Mosque. The hotel staff was very pleasant and friendly. The rooms were very clean . The buffet breakfast is generous and of excellent quality. The view from the terrace restaurant is beautiful , day and night ,overlooking on one side the Marmara Sea, the Bosphorus and on the other side the Blue Mosque and Aghia Sophia. Atmosphere and dinner in the restaurant was an enjoyable experience. We particularly appreciated the fact that we were granted an early check in .

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Theworldismyoyster50
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel which I chose following an article in the Daily Mail newspaper and I was not disappointed. Location is excellent close to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar atc etc. Had a superior room which was very nice and the whole hotel carries the Turkish theme which is nice given how most of the major chains seem so corporate these days. Took the option of a city guided tour which turned out to be a dedicated official tour guide for the two of us. Fantastic day and insight into both the city and Turkish life. The breakfast is fantastic and the view from the roof top restuarant over the city is something to be enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Geat”
Reviews.Author: AYLAN
Reviews.Content: Great Location ,Friendly Staff,clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: geriwtravel
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a very unique city. Loved the restaurant on the terrace on the roof and being able to relax and take in a 360 degree of the city, the bay with all the ships coming in, the sounds of the city coming alive. A once in a lifetime experience. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: catocat
Reviews.Content: Very good location within walking distance of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace etc. Good breakfast selection and excellent scenery from the Terrace of the hotel. Only negative was a $100 guided tour arranged by the desk that turned into a tour of the Bazaars and a carpet store rather than the historic sites. Staff was courteous and helpful with good dining recommendations in the area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: FrancesW4
Reviews.Content: The Armada Hotel is located in Sultanahmet, the old area of Istanbul. It's decor is in keeping with the area - old style Ottoman. From the hotel terrace there's a splendid view of the Marmara Sea opening into the Bosphorus, with the skyline behind framing the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia - both of which are within walking distance. These views are to be enjoyed both at breakfast, and as darkness falls. You are within 5 mins walk of Cankurtaran railway station, and for a minimal cost of 1.4 Turkish Lira it is one stop up the line to Sirkeci terminus which gives access to the excellent and very cheap tram system plus the ferries. Again, for 1.4 Turkish Lira you can go any distance on the tram! If you prefer taxis, they are easily available. The hotel staff collected us from the airport, and we arrived at the check-in desk to be given a very comfortable room with air conditioning and bath/shower room for 130 Euros per night bed and breakfast, including local tax. The view from our window was down into a street, but it wasn't noisy. The beds are firm - but if you prefer something softer, a phonecall brings an immediate response: the bed is remade instantly with a soft mattress topper, and is very comfortable. There is a plentiful, impressive buffet at breakfast, and the staff couldn't be more helpful with my personal dietary requirements, even when it required microwaving my own gluten- free dish every morning. The restaurant staff were always politely friendly. The guest relationship staff were extremely helpful with answers to our questions, and with suggestions. We found the Armada Hotel an excellent place to stay for the time we were in Istanbul, and would have no hesitation in staying there again, both for its comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: AgadirAlaturka
Reviews.Content: We have been recently to turkey on about a two week trip that includes a visit to two cities ; namely Istanbul and Antalya. In Istanbul we stayed at Armada Hotel.It combines ottoman style with modern facilities and it is located in Sultanahmet ; not far from hagia sophiia , the grand bazaar ,the tram station and other interesting areas. In the morning , you can have your delicious breakfast while enjoying a splendid view of the sea on one side and the great landscape of the blue mosque on the other. Lunch and dinner are characterized by a variety of local dishes that cater for every taste. The staff were very friendly and helpful.We liked our rooms because they were neat and tidy all the time. we really felt at home in that hotel.I would recommend it for people who seek relaxation and at the same time are interested in the historical sites of Istanbul. Personally , I would like to stay again in Armada hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: m44ever
Reviews.Content: Armada Hotel was a very fine choice for our stay in Istanbul. It is located very central with nice views to the Bosporus and Hagia Sofia/Blue Mosque. Breakfast on the terasse was very delicious and we also had one dinner which was excellent, too. The staff was friendly and the room alway very clean. I would stay again in Armada....

Reviews.Title: “Mike & Yvonnes Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MikeSRLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here on a long weekend from London. The Armada was comfortable and good value for money, great location, excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: amiz1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is greatly located. Very clean, nicely decoorated, and the breakfasts are rich and tasty.
